description.hltext_display: The Fallacy of the 1967 Borders No Such Borders Ever Existed
description.content:
* The Palestinian leadership is fixated on attempting to press foreign
governments and the UN to recognize a unilaterally declared Palestinian
state within the "1967 borders." Indeed, this campaign appeared to have some
initial successes in December 2010 when both Argentina and Brazil decided to
recognize a Palestinian state within what they described as the "1967
borders."
* But such borders do not exist and have no basis in history, law, or
fact. The only line that ever existed was the 1949 armistice demarcation
line, based on the ceasefire lines of the Israeli and Arab armies pending
agreement on permanent peace. The 1949 armistice agreements specifically
stated that such lines have no political or legal significance and do not
prejudice future negotiations on boundaries.
* UN Security Council Resolution 242 of 1967 acknowledged the need for
negotiation of secure and recognized boundaries. Prominent jurists and UN
delegates, including from Brazil and Jordan, acknowledged that the previous
lines cannot be considered as international boundaries.
* The series of agreements between the PLO and Israel (1993-1999)
reaffirm the intention and commitment of the parties to negotiate permanent
borders. During all phases of negotiation between Israel and the
Palestinians, there was never any determination as to a border based on the
1967 lines.
* The PLO leadership solemnly undertook that all issues of permanent
status would be resolved only through negotiations between the parties. The
2003 "Road Map" further reiterated the need for negotiations on final
borders.
With ongoing and increasing intensity, the Palestinian leadership is fixated
on advancing a concerted policy vis-à-vis the international community and
public opinion, demanding recognition of what they claim to be the "1967
borders," and acceptance of a unilaterally declared Palestinian state within
those borders. Indeed, this campaign appeared to have some initial successes
in December 2010 when both Argentina and Brazil decided to recognize a
Palestinian state within what they described as the "1967 borders."1
In actual fact, the Palestinian leadership, as well as members of the
international community, are well aware that such borders do not exist, nor
have they ever existed. They have never figured in any of the international,
agreed-upon documentation concerning the Israel-Arab and Israel-Palestinian
issues, and have no basis whatsoever, neither in law nor in fact.
There are no provisions in any of the agreements signed between Israel and
the Palestinians that require withdrawal to the "1967 borders." There were
never any geographic imperatives that sanctify the 1967 lines. Clearly,
there could be no legal or political logic to enshrining as an international
boundary an inadvertent and coincidental set of ceasefire lines that existed
for less than 19 years
While the above is fully evident to the Palestinian leaders who are actively
and daily advancing this policy - principally the head of the Palestinian
Authority, Mahmoud Abbas, and the head of the Negotiations Department of the
Authority, Sa'eb Erekat, both of whom were themselves actively involved in
all the stages of negotiation - they nevertheless continue with their
fixation to present the concept of the "1967 borders" as an accepted
international term-of-art and as an Israeli commitment.
The following is a summary of the background to the 1967 lines as described
in the international documentation:
UN Security Council Defines Initial Ceasefire Lines
The term "1967 lines" refers to the line from which Israel military forces
moved into the territories at the start of hostilities on June 4, 1967 ("The
Six-Day War").
These lines were not based on historical fact, natural geographic
formations, demographic considerations, or international agreement. In fact,
they had served as the agreed-upon armistice demarcation lines from the
termination of the 1948 War of Independence, pursuant to the armistice
agreements signed between Israel and its neighbors Egypt, Jordan, Syria, and
Lebanon in 1949. These lines remained valid until the outbreak of the 1967
hostilities.
The armistice demarcation line represented nothing more than the forward
lines of deployment of the forces on the day a ceasefire was declared, as
set out in Security Council Resolution 62 of November 16, 1948, which called
for the delineation of permanent armistice demarcation lines beyond which
the armed forces of the respective parties will not move. The line was
demarcated on the map attached to the armistice agreement with a green
marker pen and hence received the name "Green Line."
The Security Council in its resolution stressed the temporary nature of the
armistice lines that were to be maintained "during the transition to
permanent peace in Palestine," intimating that permanent peace would involve
negotiating permanent bilateral borders that would be different from the
armistice demarcation lines.2
1949 Armistice Agreements
In fact, the Israel-Jordan Armistice Agreement signed on April 13, 1949, as
well as all the other armistice agreements, emphasized the transitional
nature of the armistice as "an indispensable step toward the liquidation of
armed conflict and the restoration of peace in Palestine." The language of
the agreement went to great pains to stress that the armistice lines were of
a provisional and non-political nature and were not intended to, and did not
constitute international boundaries, and as such do not prejudice the
rights, claims, and positions of the parties in the ultimate peace
settlement:
"No provision of this Agreement shall in any way prejudice the rights,
claims and positions of either Party hereto in the ultimate peaceful
settlement of the Palestine question, the provisions of this Agreement being
dictated exclusively by military considerations."3
"The basic purpose of the Armistice Demarcation Lines is to delineate
the lines beyond which the armed forces of the respective Parties shall not
move."4
"The provisions of this article shall not be interpreted as prejudicing,
in any sense, an ultimate political settlement between the Parties to this
Agreement."5
"The Armistice Demarcation Lines defined in...this Agreement are agreed
upon by the Parties without prejudice to future territorial settlements or
boundary lines or to claims of either Party relating thereto."6
Subsequent Views on the Transitional Nature of the Lines
Statements from Arab and other sources between 1949 and 1967 confirm the
common understanding as to the transitional nature of the lines. During the
debate in the Security Council before the outbreak of hostilities in 1967,
the Jordanian ambassador stated:
"There is an Armistice Agreement. The Agreement did not fix boundaries;
it fixed a demarcation line. The Agreement did not pass judgment on rights
political, military or otherwise. Thus I know of no territory; I know of no
boundary; I know of a situation frozen by an Armistice Agreement."7
Prof. Mughraby wrote in the Beirut Daily Star:
"Israel is the only State in the world which has no legal boundaries
except the natural one the Mediterranean provides. The rest are nothing more
than armistice lines, can never be considered political or territorial
boundaries."8
President Lyndon Johnson is on record stating:
"The nations of the region have had only fragile and violated truce
lines for 20 years. What they now need are recognized boundaries and other
arrangements that will give them security against terror, destruction and
war."9 In this context, international jurists have also acknowledged the
limited effect of the armistice lines:
Elihu Lauterpacht, in his booklet, Jerusalem and the Holy Places, states:
"Each of these agreements...contains a provision that the armistice
lines therein laid down shall not prejudice the future political settlement.
It would not therefore be accurate to contend that questions of
title...depend on the Armistice Agreements. Questions of sovereignty are
quite independent of the Armistice Agreements."10
Judge Steven Schwebel, former President of the International Court of
Justice, stated in 1994:
"The armistice agreements of 1949 expressly preserved the territorial
claims of all parties and did not purport to establish definitive boundaries
between them."11
Security Council Resolution 242, 1967
The transitory nature of the 1949 armistice demarcation lines was clearly
acknowledged by the Security Council in Resolution 242 of 1967, after the
"Six-Day War," which affirmed, in its first paragraph:
"...respect for and acknowledgement of the sovereignty, territorial
integrity and political independence of every State in the area and their
right to live in peace within secure and recognized boundaries free from
threats or acts of force."12
There is no call in this resolution for a return to the armistice
demarcation lines or to any other line or border. The Security Council
specifically dismissed the Arab demand for a text that required Israel to
completely return all the territory it occupied during the 1967 conflict.
Israel was called upon to withdraw from "territories occupied in the recent
conflict," not from "all the territories" or even from "the territories." At
the same time, the Council called upon the parties to work together to
promote agreement on a peaceful and accepted settlement in accordance with
the provisions and principles of the resolution. Clearly this settlement was
intended to include the negotiation of secure and recognized boundaries that
would replace the armistice demarcation lines, pursuant to the above
references in the armistice agreements to the same "ultimate peaceful
settlement."
During the Security Council debate on the acceptance of Resolution 242, the
representative of Brazil, in accepting the resolution, declared:
"Its acceptance does not imply that borderlines cannot be rectified as a
result of an agreement freely concluded among the interested States. We keep
constantly in mind that a just and lasting peace in the Middle East has
necessarily to be based on secure permanent boundaries freely agreed upon
and negotiated by the neighboring States."13
Israel-Palestinian Declaration of Principles, 1993
While this fact has been widely acknowledged in both legal and political
literature throughout the years,14 the basic reciprocal undertaking by the
Palestinian and Israeli leaderships to negotiate borders between their
respective territories was given formal confirmation by Yasser Arafat, his
deputy and later replacement Mahmoud Abbas, and Sa'eb Erekat during the
groundbreaking "Declaration of Principles on Interim Self-Government
Arrangements" (signed inter alia by Abbas) of September 13, 1993, in which
the PLO and the Government of Israel acknowledged that the negotiations on
the permanent status of the relationship between them would cover:
"...remaining issues, including: Jerusalem, refugees, settlements,
security arrangements, borders, relations and cooperation with other
neighbors, and other issues of common interest."
On the eve of the signature of the above declaration, Arafat made the solemn
commitment in a letter to Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin:
"The PLO commits itself to the Middle East peace process, and to a
peaceful resolution of the conflict between the two sides and declares that
all outstanding issues relating to permanent status will be resolved through
negotiations."15
Clearly, the present, ongoing fixation by Arafat's successor, Mahmoud Abbas,
and his chief negotiator, Sa'eb Erekat, in attempting to bypass the
agreed-upon negotiating process and achieve unilateral recognition of a
Palestinian state within the "1967 borders" runs squarely against Arafat's
solemn undertaking in the name of the Palestinian people in 1993.
Israeli-Palestinian Agreements, 1993-1999
The above references to permanent status negotiations on borders and to
achieving the aims of Security Council Resolution 242 were repeated in a
series of mutually agreed documents entered into between the PLO and the
Israel Government.16 Furthermore, with a view to strengthening this
commitment, they undertook in the 1995 Interim Agreement not to act
unilaterally to change the status of the territories pending outcome of
those permanent status negotiations:
"...neither side shall initiate or take any step that will change the
status of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip pending the outcome of the
permanent status negotiations."17
This undertaking was reiterated by the parties in Article 9 of the 1999
Sharm el Shiekh Memorandum:
"Recognizing the necessity to create a positive environment for the
negotiations, neither side shall initiate or take any step that will change
the status of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip in accordance with the
Interim Agreement."
Throughout all the phases of the negotiations on these various agreements
and memoranda between Israel and the Palestinians, and in the texts of these
documents, there was never any reference to the 1967 lines as a potential
border between the two neighbors, nor was there any reference to any
commitment or obligation by Israel to withdraw to the 1967 lines.
Road Map, 2003
Further indication of the non-existence of "1967 borders" and the rejection
of any unilateral act by the Palestinians is evident from the terms of the
Quartet-initiated "Performance-Based Roadmap to a Permanent Two-State
Solution to the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict" of April 30, 2003.18 In this
document the parties were expected, in the second and third phases of
implementation of the "Road Map" and after election of a responsible
Palestinian leadership, to engage in negotiation focusing on the option of
creating an independent, viable Palestinian state, initially with
"provisional borders." This was intended to serve as a way-station to the
permanent settlement that was scheduled for the third stage, where final
status borders would be recognized by an international conference convened
for that purpose.
Clearly, if and when the parties return to a modus of bona fide negotiation
and reach the issue of defining their mutual border, the 1967 line could
indeed figure as a point of reference in the negotiations between them,
assuming that it answers the criteria set out by the Security Council for a
border that will avoid situations of threats of force and violence.
But this can only emanate from a reciprocal and good faith attempt by the
parties to act together, and not unilaterally, in determining their own
borders, based on their mutual interests as neighbors. Such issues cannot
and must not be dictated from outside, whether by the UN or by individual
states.
Thus, in light of all the above, the question arises if and when the
Palestinian leadership will come to admit the absurdity in attempting to
invent "1967 borders" that obviously lack any historical, legal, or factual
basis?
Similarly, one may ask when they will see the utter lack of pragmatism and
realism in their attempt to dictate to the international community a
unilateral Palestinian state in violation of their own commitments,
undermining the internationally accepted Middle East peace process as well
as internationally recognized and witnessed documents.
* * *
1. For the text of the Argentinean declaration, see
http://www.mrecic.gov.ar/. The text of the Brazilian declaration may be
found at
http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/reconhecimento-do-estado-palestino-nas-fronteiras-de-1967.
2. S/RES/62 (1948)S/1080, 16 November 1948.
3. Article II(2),
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Foreign+Relations/Israels+Foreign+Relations+since+1947/1947-1974/Israel-Jordan+Armistice+Agreement.htm.
4. Article IV(2).
5. Article VI(8).
6. Article VI(9).
7. 1345th meeting of the Security Council, May 31, 1967.
8. Beirut Daily Star, May 28, 1967.
9. Department of State Bulletin 33, June 19, 1967.
10. Elihu Lauterpacht, Jerusalem and the Holy Places (London, 1968), p. 45.
11. Justice in International Law, Selected Writings of Judge Stephen M.
Schwebel (Cambridge University Press, 1994).
12. UN Security Council Resolution 242, November 22, 1967,
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Peace+Process/Guide+to+the+Peace+Process/UN+Security+Council+Resolution+242.htm.
13. S/PV.1382(OR), 22 November 1967. See also Alan Baker, "Recognition of a
Palestinian State - Premature,
Legally Invalid, and Undermining any Bona Fide Negotiation Process,"
Jerusalem Issue Brief, December 9, 2010,
http://www.jcpa.org/JCPA/Templates/ShowPage.asp?DRIT=1&DBID=1&LNGID=1&TMID=111&FID=582&PID=2225&IID=5441&TTL=Recognition_of_a_Palestinian_State_%E2%80%93_Premature,_Legally_Invalid,_and_Undermining_any_Bona_Fide_Negotiation_Process.
14. For example, see Prof. Ruth Lapidoth, "Security Council Resolution 242
at Twenty Five," Israel Law Review, vol. 26, 1992, pp. 295-318. Ministry for
Foreign Affairs: The First Fifty Years (Jerusalem, Keter), vol. 4, pp.
840-853 (Hebrew).
15. Exchange of letters between Yasser Arafat and Yitzhak Rabin, July 9,
1993,
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Peace+Process/Guide+to+the+Peace+Process/Israel-PLO+Recognition+-+Exchange+of+Letters+betwe.htm.
16. See, for example, the "Israeli-Palestinian Interim Agreement on the West
Bank and the Gaza Strip," Washington, D.C., September 28, 1995, Preamble,
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Peace+Process/Guide+to+the+Peace+Process/THE+ISRAELI-PALESTINIAN+INTERIM+AGREEMENT.htm;
and see the "1999 Sharm el-Sheikh Memorandum on Implementation Timeline of
Outstanding Commitments of Agreements Signed and the Resumption of Permanent
Status Negotiations," 4 September 1999, Article 1.
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/MFAArchive/1990_1999/1999/9/Sharm+el-Sheikh+Memorandum+on+Implementation+Timel.htm.
17. Article XXXI (7).
18. See
http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Peace+Process/Guide+to+the+Peace+Process/A+Performance-Based+Roadmap+to+a+Permanent+Two-Sta.htm.
* * *
Amb. Alan Baker, Director of the Institute for Contemporary Affairs at the
Jerusalem Center for Public Affairs, is former Legal Adviser to Israel's
Foreign Ministry and former Ambassador of Israel to Canada. He is a partner
in the law firm of Moshe, Bloomfield, Kobo, Baker & Co. He participated in
the negotiation and drafting of the various agreements comprising the Oslo

description.hltext_display: Амкар играет в прятки
description.content:
Это произошло сразу после проведения жеребьевки календаря чемпионата России по футболу 2011/2012 годов, в котором пермский клуб еще значится среди участников турнира.
Во вторник пермский «Амкар» объявил о решении покинуть премьер-лигу. Сенсационная новость была опубликована на официальном сайте клуба в тот момент, когда в Москве проходила жеребьевка нового сезона.
«В связи со сложной финансовой ситуацией, сложившейся в клубе, принято решение о добровольном выходе ФК «Амкар» в первую лигу», – говорится в заявлении. Согласно сообщению, долги клуба составляют 167 миллионов рублей, а переговоры с потенциальными инвесторами результата не принесли. Туманной остается ситуация и с привлечением внебюджетных средств на следующий сезон. «В связи с этим накануне состоялось собрание общественной организации города Перми «Футбольный клуб «Амкар», на котором президент клуба Валерий Михайлович Чупраков вынес на повестку-предложение о добровольном выходе ФК «Амкар» из состава российской футбольной премьер-лиги. Предложение было единогласно поддержано всеми семью членами общественной организации из восьми. Официальное письмо было отослано в РФПЛ», – говорится на официальном сайте клуба.
Присутствовавшему в столице директору команды Сергею Грушкевичу ничего об этом не было известно. Как ни в чем не бывало он принял участие в жеребьевке и в первом туре готовился играть в Москве с ЦСКА.
«Я не в курсе этого, так же как и представитель «Амкара», присутствовавший на жеребьевке, – заявил «Газете.Ru» президент РФПЛ Сергей Прядкин. – На данный момент он пытается выяснить, что происходит. Не исключаю, что это может быть давление. Если данная информация подтвердится, то место в премьер-лиге получит команда, занявшее третье место в первом дивизионе, если она не сможет, то обладатель четвертой строчки и т. д. Надеюсь, мы не опустимся до восьмого места». По регламенту, возвращение владикавказской «Алании» исключено, подчеркнул Прядкин. Третье место в турнире первого дивизиона занял ФК «Нижний Новгород», четвертое – «КАМАЗ» из Набережных Челнов. На восьмом месте, кстати, обосновалась сочинская «Жемчужина».
Однако потом происходящее стало больше напоминать цирк. Через час сообщение с официального сайта клуба исчезло, а поклонники «Амкара» в гостевой книге вовсю собирались писать письмо Владимиру Путину, памятуя о том, что аналогичный шаг спас бедствовавшую «Томь» и помог «Крыльям Советов».
Через какое-то время новость на главной странице официального сайта снова появилась.
Но по сообщению СЭ, решение о снятии «Амкара» с чемпионата нелегитимно. В понедельник состоялось заседание членов правления «Амкара». По результатам работа за год была признана неудовлетворительной. Президенту клуба Валерию Чупракову было предложено покинуть свой пост. Однако он единолично принял решение снять клуб с чемпионата России. В связи с чем решение о вылете «Амкара» не является законным. Это подтвердили несколько членов правления клуба.
Тут же РИА «Новости» со ссылкой на источник в клубе сообщили, что информация на официальном сайте оказалась шуткой отправленного в отставку Валерия Чупракова. По словам источника, Чупраков посчитал несправедливым решение членов правления клуба о своей отставке, и сообщение о снятии «Амкара» появилось с его подачи вскоре после жеребьевки календаря нового сезона чемпионата России.
А вице-президент «Амкара» Геннадий Шилов отказался комментировать ситуацию. «Пока никаких комментариев не будет, я не могу дозвониться до президента», - сказал Шилов РИА «Новости».
Однако Чупраков все же вышел на связь и подтвердил РИА «Новости» то, что команда снимается с турнира премьер-лиги. «Все, что в последнее время произошло в клубе, сейчас размещено на странице его официального сайта», – заявил он.
Ну а сама жеребьевка прошла без эксцессов – под музыку и пляски. Еще в апреле президент Российского футбольного союза Сергей Фурсенко заявлял о намерении изменить формат жеребьевки календаря чемпионата России в премьер-лиге. В итоге было решено прибегнуть к помощи современных технологий. Специалисты разработали специальную беспристрастную программу.
До жеребьевки календаря команды в результате предварительного посева были разбиты на 4 корзины.
Было решено, что домашние матчи удаленных команд – «Томи» и «Амкара» – будут проводиться в разных турах, южные клубы («Анжи», Кубань», «Ростов», «Спартак-Нальчик» и «Терек») проведут поединки стартового тура дома. В первую корзину попали участники еврокубков «Зенит», ЦСКА, «Рубин» и московский «Спартак»: у этих команд самый сложный календарь весной (чемпионат России, Лига Европы и Кубок России). Во второй были «Ростов», «Анжи», «Спартак-Нальчик» и «Кубань». Третью составили «Крылья Советов», «Терек», «Томь» и «Амкар». А в четвертой корзине пребывали все остальные команды – «Локомотив», «Динамо», «Сатурн» и «Волга».
В предстоящем чемпионате третий круг пройдет уже в 2012 году. Команды будут разбиты на две группы (1–8 и 9–16 места). Лучший октет разыграет медали и места в еврокубках, а оставшиеся команды будут вести борьбу за выживание. Те, которые займут 15-е и 16-е места, автоматически покидают элиту, а те, что расположатся по итогам первенства на 13-м и 14-м, сыграют стыковые переходные матчи с 3-м и 4-м клубами первого дивизиона.
В ходе жеребьёвки учитывались следующие критерии: климатические условия, тип поля, расстояния, матчи команд в еврокубках, матчи сборной России, матчи Кубка и Суперкубка России, совместное использование стадионов, рейтинг клубов, национальные праздники. «Предстоящий сезон, переходный, в преддверии системы «осень – весна» – самый сложный этап в отечественном футболе, – сказал президент РФПЛ Сергей Прядкин. – Но в дальнейшем все уже пойдет по накатанной линии».
Представителям «Кубани» и «Волги» были вручены сертификаты о принятии в члены РФПЛ. Московскому «Спартаку» вручили приз за лучшие суммарные результаты основных и дублирующих составов.
Болельщики «Томи» по итогам прошедшего чемпионата России признаны самыми корректными.
Процедура жеребьевки стартовала с того, что представители команд, доставая шары, выбирали для себя соответствующую условную группу. В первую попали «Зенит», «Сатурн», «Терек», «Кубань»; во вторую – «Рубин», «Локомотив», «Амкар» и «Ростов»; в третью – ЦСКА, «Волга», «Крылья Советов, «Анжи»; в четвертую – «Спартак», «Динамо», «Томь», «Спартак-Нальчик».
Само же расписание матчей чемпионата при помощи специальной программы вскоре составил компьютер. В результате в первом туре (11–13 марта) встречаются «Локомотив» – «Динамо», «Волга» – «Томь», «Спартак» – «Ростов», «Анжи» – «Сатурн», «Терек» – «Зенит», «Спартак-Нальчик» – «Крылья Советов», ЦСКА – «Амкар» и «Кубань» – «Рубин». Полный календарь чемпионата «Газета.Ru» опубликует позднее.
Новости российского футбола можно посмотреть на странице чемпионата России.
Тeги: Жеребьевка чемпионата России по футболу, Сергей Прядкин, Николай Трубач, ФК Амкар

description.hltext_display: You Can Work At Your Kitchen Table. Should You? Posted By: Stephanie Foster
description.content:
One of the advantages of working at home is sometimes said to be that you can work at your kitchen table. It's meant to emphasize the flexibility you have when you work at home. But is working at your kitchen table really a good idea?
If you have an option, I'd recommend working elsewhere in your home. Sometimes the kitchen table really is the best choice for your situation. If you have a better spot to work, however, I'd suggest using it. There are a couple of reasons.
1. Too much in the middle of things.
The first problem with working at the kitchen table is that you're right in the middle of things. This makes it too easy to let work get in the way of enjoying your family life. It's too accessible, and too easy to stop and just do "one more thing" when you should be paying attention to other things.
It's also too accessible to any kids in the house. This is particularly true if you have little kids who don't always understand the limits you set. Kids can be accidentally destructive. We nearly lost my daughter's gingerbread house project, for example, because my son spilled water all over the kitchen table while the parts were sitting there. It's too easy to have things like that happen to your work things as well.
It's also not so good when you're trying to work. You're easily interrupted. You may be able to see what the rest of the family is doing and be distracted by the goings on. The kitchen table or other common areas of the home just aren't separate enough to give that "at work feeling" that helps many work at home parents focus on what they need to be getting done.
2. A kitchen table setup is rarely good ergonomically speaking.
Most of us don't pay a lot of attention to ergonomics while working. Many don't know that much about ergonomics. But if you want to keep working and cut down on the odds of repetitive stress injuries, you'll want to consider ergonomics, even if you feel comfortable working just about anywhere now. It takes time to get a repetitive stress injury, and they're no fun to recover from.
If you're having to bend your wrists much up or down in order to type, you're not in a healthy position. You're putting strain on your wrists.
You also shouldn't have to look up at your computer monitor. The top of the screen should be about level with your eyes. Looking up for long periods puts a strain on your neck.
While it's not easy to build the habit of paying attention to ergonomics, it's a really good idea to do so. You can save yourself a lot of pain in the long run. There's a lot more to it than these basics, but the general idea is to avoid putting strain on any parts of your body while you work. It wouldn't hurt to read up on ergonomics on your own.

description.hltext_display: Do You Really Need Every Piece Of Golf Equipment Available?
description.content:
There are many different types of golf equipment and all have the ability to improve your game tenfold as long as you use them to their fullest extent. If you go into the local golf shop, you will notice a large variety of equipment ranging from golf clubs, to putting machines. In fact golf is one of the only sports where the equipment you buy will shape the way you play out there on the course. Golf ClubsGolfer's normally carry around 14 golf clubs in a set. They are made up of five different types and are named; woods, irons, putters, hybrid and wedges. Each different type of golf club has a different purpose altogether.Woods are used for a few purposes. One, the driver is used to normally tee off on a par four or par five hole. Two fairway woods such as the three and five wood can be used to hit from fairways where the distance away from the pin is too great to use an iron. Lastly, many golfers use woods when chipping out of rough. This enables them to hit a ball that will run or roll for an extended period of time, usually when the green a larger than normal.The hybrid is a combination of the irons and woods, which is mostly used for long shots from hard grounds and the rough. Wedges are used to play shorter shots from rough and hard ground such as sand or the rough. Irons are of course used for mid ranged shots where players are looking to land their ball on the green, however many golfers opt for irons when choosing to lay up, when a hole is just a little too long.There are many manufacturers of good golf clubs, but the most famous ones are Nike, Callaway, and Mizuno Golf, such as Callaway X-22 Irons 3-9PS, Mizuno MX-200 Irons an so on.
Golf ballThis golf equipment is another important feature to a player. Golf balls nowadays come in two-piece, three-piece and even four-piece forms. These are much different from those used in the old days of golf matches, these balls are very much more responsive and durable, as well as last longer compared to the former balls. There are many good and famous makers of golf balls. Just to name a few; Maxfli, Ben Hogan, Precept, Nike, Callaway, Mizuno, and many more. These makers have a vast range of balls with competitive level of quality. Most of the balls nowadays come with super-features such as having thermoplastic urethane as covers and having titanium, nickel or cobalt cores. Golf equipment on www.wholesalegolfseller.com

description.hltext_display: Sewage stink empties parts of U.N.
description.content:
NEW YORK, Dec. 22 (UPI) -- U.N. officials said two areas of the organization's New York headquarters were evacuated due to a stink believed to have come from a sewer line.
U.N. spokesman Farhan Haq said diplomats were evacuated from the Security Council and General Assembly as a "precautionary measure" due to a "suspicious odor," the New York Post reported Tuesday.
Police said the odor is believed to have come from a burst sewer pipe in the facility's basement.
Among those evacuated were children from several countries brought to the U.N. Security Council to address world leaders during a ceremonial session.

description.hltext_display: Prachtbau für die Provinz
description.content:
Von Oliver Trenkamp dpa Für 58 Millionen Euro gönnt sich die Uni Lüneburg ein neues Hauptgebäude von Stararchitekt Daniel Libeskind. Studenten trommelten dagegen, Politiker sahen ein Luftschloss mit unsauberen Finanzierungs-Tricks. Jetzt hat die Hochschule verraten, wer das Raumschiff in der Heide bezahlen soll.
Namen sind Nachrichten, das weiß die Uni-Leitung in Lüneburg. Und je bekannter ein Name, je prominenter, desto mehr von seiner Bekanntheit strahlt ab auf die Hochschule selbst - das ist die Idee. Deshalb ließ die Uni ihre Erstsemester schon mal vom ehemaligen US-Präsidenten Jimmy Carter begrüßen und von Christian Wulff, als der noch Ministerpräsident von Niedersachsen war. Auch Angela Merkel schaute vorbei auf ihrer Showreise durch die von ihr ausgerufene "Bildungsrepublik". Der am häufigsten genannte Promi-Name in Lüneburg dürfte momentan allerdings der von Daniel Libeskind sein: Der Architekt hält gelegentlich Vorlesungen in der niedersächsischen Kleinstadt - und er hat das neue futuristische Hauptgebäude entworfen, das die Uni jetzt in Eigenregie errichten will. Für 57,7 Millionen Euro soll bis Ostern 2014 eine silbern gezackte Fassade Richtung Himmel wachsen, 38 Meter hoch, mit Platz für 1200 Menschen.
Zügig sollen die Arbeiten starten, die Grundsteinlegung ist bereits für das kommende Frühjahr geplant. Die Heidschnucken werden sich also demnächst mächtig erschrecken - erst über die an- und abrollenden Baufahrzeuge, dann über den raumschiffartigen Koloss, der so gar nicht in die beschauliche Umgebung passen will. Der Prachtbau in der Provinz ist durchaus umstritten: Studentenvertreter nannten ihn "nicht zweckmäßig", Landespolitiker hielten es für ein Luftschloss, weil die Finanzierung nicht gesichert sei. Zwischenzeitlich drohte der Bau : Vogelfreunde hatten auf dem Campus zwei Haubenlerchen-Pärchen entdeckt, eine akut vom Aussterben bedrohte Vogelart. FOTOSTRECKE 8 Bilder Zudem umfassten die Pläne ursprünglich, zusammen mit Partnern aus der Privatwirtschaft ein Hotel und Parkplätze auf dem Campus zu errichten - neudeutsch "Public-Private-Partnership" (PPP). Auch dagegen richtete sich Kritik: Ein privater Investor, der Nutzungsrechte auf dem Uni-Gelände hätte, das sahen nicht nur Studentenvertreter und die Grünen im Landtag kritisch.
Wie erfindet man eine Uni neu?
Jetzt kündigte die Uni an, den Bau in Eigenregie zu errichten, ganz ohne private Partner, ohne Hotel, ohne Parkplatz. Die Uni-Leitung konkretisierte auch, woher das Geld kommen soll. So soll das Land Niedersachsen 18,6 Millionen Euro beisteuern, die Europäische Union 14 Millionen, Stadt Lüneburg und Landkreis Lüneburg zusammen sieben Millionen und das Bundeswirtschaftsministerium mehr als zwei Millionen. Hinzu kommen demnach ein paar kleinere Geldgeber, etwa die Kirchen.
Es ist ein Prestige-Projekt, Teil eines Plans, mit dem Uni-Präsident Sascha Spoun und sein Stellvertreter Holm Keller die Hochschule neu erfinden wollen. Der eine war beim Amtsantritt 2006 mit 36 Jahren der , der andere arbeitete früher bei McKinsey und Bertelsmann. Eine Elite-Akademikerschmiede wollen sie aus der Provinz-Uni machen, die hervorgegangen ist aus einer Fachhochschule und einer Pädagogischen Hochschule. Eine Werbeagentur steuerte sogar einen neuen Namen bei: Leuphana, so nennt sich die Uni seit einigen Jahren.
"Wir sind eine kleine Universität, die sich viel vorgenommen hat", beschreibt Ex-Werber Keller, der New Yorker Architekten Libeskind schon lange kennt, den . Vergessen machen wollen sie jene Zeiten, da die "Frankfurter Allgemeine" die Strahlkraft der Uni spöttisch mit einer "Energiesparlampe der ersten Generation" verglich.
"Das entschärft die Auseinandersetzung"
Um sich den Traum vom Libeskind-Bau zu erfüllen, muss die Uni aber auch selbst Geld beisteuern. Deshalb will sie Grundstücke und Gebäude verkaufen und so neun Millionen Euro zusammenbekommen. Dabei handelt es sich unter anderem um einen Neu- und einen Altbau, in dem bislang die Wirtschaftsfakultät untergebracht ist, die Informatik und die Automatisierungstechnik, wie Uni-Sprecher Henning Zühlsdorff SPIEGEL ONLINE sagte. Das Ziel sei es, die gesamte Uni an einem zentralen Standort zusammenzuführen. Die Finanzierung sei gesichert. Ein Stück weit beruhigt die neue Ankündigung einige der Kritiker. Vor wenigen Wochen sprach etwa Gabriele Heinen-Kljajic, stellvertretende Vorsitzende der Grünen-Fraktion im Landtag, in der "Welt" noch von "windigen Ideen", als es um die Finanzierungsvorschläge aus Lüneburg ging. Jetzt sagte sie SPIEGEL ONLINE, es sei "klug, sich von Hotel und Parkplatz zu verabschieden". Der Verzicht auf private Partner entschärfe die Auseinandersetzung. Allerdings mahnte sie, die Uni dürfe ihre Grundstücke und Gebäude keinesfalls unter Wert verkaufen.
Weder die Uni-Leitung noch das niedersächsische Wissenschaftsministerium wollen den Verzicht auf Partner aus der Wirtschaft als Scheitern verstanden wissen. Ein Ministeriumssprecher sagte, diese Option habe es von Anfang an gegeben. Zudem seien durch das PPP-Verfahren Einsparmöglichkeiten entdeckt worden. Anfangs sei mit 61,4 Millionen Euro gerechnet worden, jetzt noch mit 57,7. Die Uni teilte mit, sie verzichte auf einen privaten Partner, weil dies keine wirtschaftlichere Alternative sei.
Wenn alles klappt, wird sich die Leuphana-Uni also auch mit dem Namen Libeskind schmücken können, nicht nur als Gastprofessor, sondern mit ihrem neuen Hauptgebäude. Aber natürlich lädt sie auch weiter andere Prominente ein: So sprach als Gastredner auf dem Campus vor wenigen Wochen Ulrich Wickert. Namen sind Nachrichten.
Mit Material von dpa und ddp

description.hltext_display: ARM-chipeken is futni fog a Windows?
description.content:
A Microsoft dolgozik a Windows egy olyan kiadásának fejlesztésén, amely a ma mobiltelefonokban és táblagépekben elterjedt ARM-architektúrájú processzorokon fut – szellőztette meg nevük elhallgatását kérő belsős forrásokra hivatkozva a Bloomberg és a Wall Street Journal. A lapok szerint az operációs rendszer e változatát a vállalat a január elején Las Vegasban megrendezendő Consumer Electronics Show (CES) szórakoztatóelektronikai kiállításon leplezi le, de a termék csak két év múlva kerül majd piacra.
Az ARM-hoz igazított rendszer teljes értékű, nem csökkentett funkcionalitású Windows lesz – hangsúlyozzák –, olyan, amilyet eddig csak Intel-architektúrákhoz fejlesztett a redmondi cég. Az értesülést sem a Microsoft, sem az ARM nem kívánta kommentálni.
A belsős források szerint a rendszer fejlesztésén „már egy ideje” dolgozik a szoftvervállalat, amely e kiadástól azt várja, hogy jelentősen javítja a versenyesélyeit az okostelefonok és a legújabb divatnak számító tabletek piacán. E Windows-kiadást moduláris felépítésű lesz azért, hogy a hardvergyártók az egyes készülékek igényeihez tudják majd szabni – írják.
A projekt és a felvázolt célja azonban nemigen van összhangban egymással. Hiszen azokban a termékkategóriákban, ahol a lapok szerint a Microsoft e kiadással erősíteni szeretné a pozícióját, a mobiltelefonos operációs rendszerek – az Apple iOS és a Google Android – az uralkodóak, nem pedig a teljes értékű asztali rendszerek. Ráadásul ilyen mobil OS-szel Redmond is rendelkezik, annak legújabb változatát, az ARM-chipeken futó Windows Phone 7-et� . Készül emellett a céleszközökbe szánt Windows Embedded Compact 7 (Windows CE 7) is, amelynek idén nyáron tették közzé az előzetesét, a kiadását pedig 2011 első negyedévére tervezik. Ezt a szériát – mely az Intel x86 mellett ARM- és SuperH-platformon is működik – többek között navigációs készülékekben, ATM-ekben, járművek fedélzeti számítógépeiben használják.
E két rendszer nem a „nagy” Windowsokban működő NT kernelre, hanem egy annál egyszerűbb kernelre épül. A Windows CE ráadásul moduláris felépítésű, a rendszer egy részét a Microsoft forráskódként adja át a gyártópartnereknek, hogy azok az egyedi hardverhez tudják igazítani a szoftvert.

description.hltext_display: Sunshine And Smiles - A Malta Holiday Posted By: Henry Ashworth
description.content:
Like any other business the holidays industry thrives on repeat customers, or put another way people who have been happy with a product or service enough to buy it again, and if repeat customers can be built up it leads over time to a successful business.
And in a recent survey of tourists who had visited Malta for a holiday, the results were good and shows that Malta is an ideal Mediterranean holidays destination.
The sample base was large at nearly 2000 tourists, and a remarkable 86 per cent of those who participated said that their time in Malta had met or exceeded their expectations.
While good, other figures revealed in the survey give hope that Malta is building itself as a holidays destination, and once the economy improves will see year on year increases in visitor numbers again.
If holiday destinations can impress visitors enough to want to visit again in the future, it helps to give those investing in the Malta holidays trade confidence to go ahead, while the extra revenue gained by the government through employment and sales taxes give it the ability to spend money on the infrastructure expected by holidaymakers.
No less than 87 per cent of those surveyed who had just had their Malta holidays said they would recommend Malta to others - not just an impressive figure but a vital one for a destination trying to compete with countries like Spain with massive advertising budgets and a rich history of tourism who can rely on repeat visitors to use as a base every year when drawing holidaymakers to their shores.
Word of mouth and a recommendation from someone trusted is worth far more than any advertising campaign for a destination like Malta which many people might not have considered before, hopefully enough to pique curiosity to look at Mata what has to offer for a holiday.
So what areas of Malta do holidaymakers typically head for - and what can Malta offer that's a bit different from other holiday destinations?
For a taste of the more modern side of Malta, there is the St. Paul's Bay area and the seafront at Bugibba, the hub of nightlife in the area. Here, there are a selection of trendy boutiques and restaurants. When the sun sets, Malta can go down market as well as up market and there are karaoke bars in Bugibba, but there is also the casino and a cinema.
From the nightlife of Paceville to the view of the sea, Malta has much to offer every age group. Even though the visitors to Malta used to be retirement age, a great set of clubs, discos and bars has developed over the years.
Paceville is the nightlife capital of Malta. Most of the venues of Paceville are located on four main streets that spread out from the main square. These streets are Dragonara Road, Wilga Street, St. Georges Road and St. Rita Steps. A police presence is always nearby, keeping the denizens of the clubs safe and orderly. A taxi rank is also located in the main square, for those who need a lift.
For those who prefer a more genteel holiday, Wherever you go you will find something wonderful to see in Malta. The ruggedly beautiful coastline of Malta offers some fantastic views. It's an island of culture and history but with the incredible beaches and secluded coves it can be a romantic setting for a honeymoon or a great place to simply get away from it all as well.
You have an 86 per cent chance of having a fantastic holiday in Malta if you visit in 2011!
Article Source: http://www.articlesnatch.com
About the Author:
More information about Malta including both the airport and flights to Malta for 2011 are at yourmalta.com along with for those wishing to move there permanently Malta real estate choices.
For next summer there are photographs for some of the popular hotels in Malta and Gozo.
Tags: Malta , happiness , surveys , tourists , holidaymakers
|

description.hltext_display: SPL: Celtic 1 Kilmarnock 1
description.content:
CELTIC drew their third home match in a row and left Parkhead to a chorus of jeers yet again.
But it was Kilmarnock who left Glasgow's East End wondering what might have been after coming within five minutes of busting a 55-year jinx.
Conor Sammon's sensational solo effort nine minutes after the break looked to have given Mixu Paatelainen's men an incredible victory after they'd survived a first-half mauling.
Thomas Rogne's 85th-minute header snatched a point for Celtic but it was scant consolation on a night when victory would have taken them above Rangers. Now they trail by two points having played a game more.
And they lost top scorer Gary Hooper to what is a serious ankle injury. This was not a good night for Neil Lennon, whose team have won just three of their last eight matches, but it was almost a great one for Paatelainen.
In a season blighted by barminess we had a match taking place four days before Christmas in temperatures of minus 10 degrees. The same match was postponed on a day the mercury had climbed to a balmy six degrees and the surrounding areas were more treacherous last night.
Then again, there weren't many folk slipping along London Road last night. Vast swathes of empty green seats greeted the players as they stepped on to the pitch through a layer of freezing fog. It was colder than an eskimo's nose.
Celtic hadn't played since the home draw against Dundee United on November 27 and there was an eagerness about their work.
Kilmarnock, for all their fine form of late, began tentatively and could have been two down in 11 minutes but escaped punishment for two glaring errors.
Four minutes in, James Fowler inexplicably passed straight to Niall McGinn inside his own box but Cammy Bell saved the tame effort.
McGinn was then given another gift, from Frazer Wright this time, when the centre-back seemed to have cleared the danger before miscuing into the winger's path and he cut inside to blaze a shot over when he should have done better.
Paatelainen's men would have been thankful the chances hadn't fallen to Hooper. The Englishman showed his predatory instincts in between the two gifts by slotting away a chance only to be denied by a justified offside flag.
Willie Collum, at Parkhead for the first time since he infuriated Celtic at the last Old Firm game, had a quiet start but booked Fowler in the 17th minute for a rash challenge on Joe Ledley.
Two minutes later McGinn should have been celebrating his hat-trick but was left still waiting for a first goal.
Hooper released him with a terrific ball inside left-back Ben Gordon and McGinn was in on Bell again. This time he hit the target - and the keeper.
Bell came to the rescue again a couple of minutes later after Alexei Eremenko of all people was guilty of surrendering possession 25 yards from his own goal. That allowed James Forrest - back in the fold for the first time in three months - to smash a fine shot goalwards only for the keeper to make a fine block.
Daniel Majstorovic was inches wide with a header from a Ki Sung-Yeung corner and the Korean was equally unlucky with a free-kick that flew just over but somehow Kilmarnock, who had not strung together two passes, were still level.
Celtic were dealt a massive blow just after half an hour when Hooper went down after a tangle with Wright.
It looked innocuous but the striker signalled to the bench he was in trouble and after receiving lengthy treatment he was strapped on to a stretcher and led away to be replaced by Anthony Stokes.
The play continued to flow towards Bell after the break but Celtic's intensity had waned and Lennon was increasingly agitated. His mood was to get much worse in 54 minutes as Celtic's defence allowed Sammon to run 40 yards unmolested to score an incredible opener.
Sammon is in the form of his life but his 15th goal of the season was something special. Killie had been defending a corner when Mehdi Taouil got hold of the ball and found the Irishman.
He ran in behind Cha Du-Ri, shrugged of a weak challenge from Emilio Izaguirre and found himself one on one with Fraser Forster.
The finish, to the side of the keeper from an angle, was that of a supremely confident striker.
It was time for serious action from Celtic and Scott Brown was thrown in after 66 minutes to replace the totally ineffectual Ledley.
There was mounting venom in the stands and the sight of Sammon cutting inside Majstorovic easily and stabbing in another shot, saved this time, almost tipped the home support over the edge.
As Celtic's confidence evaporated, Killie's grew. They knocked the ball about well and 20 minutes from time Lennon hooked McGinn for Paddy McCourt.
But it was Daryl Murphy who had the chance to level but scooped the ball over with 14 minutes left. It was another example of Celtic's lack of ruthlessness.
History was crooking its finger in Kilmarnock's direction and beckoning them towards it but they couldn't embrace the moment. With five minutes left they cracked and Celtic equalised.
Jamie Hamill fouled Izaguirre and Ki fired the free-kick to the back post where Rogne rose to bullet home the leveller.
Celtic had claims for a handball on the edge of the box ignored and Sammon burst out to round Forster at the other end, with only Majstorovic's lunge on the line preventing Killie winning it.

description.content:
Игроки ЦСКА после поражения от "Спартака" в Сокольниках

2-0. Сидякин (Будкин), 31:52
3-0. Князев (Пиганович, М.Юньков), 53:01-бол
Спартак: Гашек - Будкин, Селезнев, Баранка, Бодров, Вишневский, Пиганович - Суглобов, Жуков, Губин, Шкотов, Ружичка, Федоров, Сидякин, Микуш, М.Юньков, Князев, Радивоевич, Лапенков
ЦСКА: Валикетт - Пашнин, Марченко, Курбатов, Мишарин, Часлава, Корнеев, Пиларж, Рылов - Пронин, Михайлов, Марек, Андронов, Штястны, Паршин, Зубов, Бадюков, Нетик, Козлов, Кулемин, Гусев
Броски: 30 (5-13-12) - 24 (14-6-4)
Штраф: 17-29
Судьи: Оленин, Раводин (оба - Москва)
Москва. ДС "Сокольники". 2750 зрителей
Нападающий ЦСКА Николай Пронин после поражения от «Спартака» в Сокольниках назвал бредом разговоры о нездоровой обстановке в команде. Защитник армейцев Константин Корнеев назвал матч равным, а его партнер Яков Рылов заметил, что команда немного расслабилась после неплохого для нее первого периода.
После поражения от «Спартака» в Сокольниках хоккеисты ЦСКА, в общем и целом, согласились с тем, что причиной неудачи в четвертом по счету дерби в сезоне стало отсутствие должной реализации голевых моментов. Причем сама по себе игра получилась равной, но все решили отдельные моменты, которые красно-белые реализовали в свою пользу.
«Если мы хотим играть и выигрывать, то нам надо усиливать свою игру, Сложно одерживать победу, не забивая в матче ни одного гола, – сказал после матча капитан армейцев Николай Пронин. – Мы должны были решать исход игры в первом периоде, когда имели численное преимущество несколько раз. Да, играли неплохо, но чего-то не хватило».
Один из опытных игроков ЦСКА опроверг информацию о нездоровой обстановке в армейском коллективе.
«Это полный бред. У нас прекрасный коллектив, замечательная атмосфера», – отметил он. Также он сказал, что не слышал вовремя матча скандирования болельщиков, направленные против нынешнего главного тренера команды Сергея Немчинова. «Нет, таких выкриков я не слышал. Но они, прежде всего, направлены в наш адрес. Хочется извиниться перед болельщиками за такую нашу игру», – добавил он.
Защитник ЦСКА Константин Корнеев объяснил, почему его команда, в первом периоде имевшая явное преимущество, не смогла забить, а в оставшихся двух периодах пропустила три шайбы. «В первом периоде у нас было много времени игры в большинстве. К сожалению, мы не смогли его использовать и забить гол, который был нам очень нужен. Это наша вина, – сказал он. – Если говорить о степени случайности пропущенных голов, то второй был забит после отскока, а третий в ходе игры в меньшинстве. Но игра была равной».
По его словам, несмотря на поражение, армейцы никак не подавлены.
«Главное, чтобы были у нее удачи и уверенность в плане завершения атак. Нужно использовать моменты, вкладываться в них, – добавил он, согласившись с мнением своего капитана относительно критики Немчинова болельщиками. – Это критика в адрес и нас, игроков. Болельщиков можно прекрасно понять. Они поддерживают нас и их можно понять».
Во все аспектах с ним согласился и другой игрок обороны Яков Рылов. «Мы здорово начали матч, может быть, немного успокоились, поскольку инициатива была в наших руках, – сказал он. – В итоге, соперник по-другому настроился на последние два периода, а мы же начали допускать ненужные ошибки». Рылов не стал говорить о том, что им говорил их тренер после матча в раздевалке. «Давайте это оставим между нами. Ругал ли он нас? Ну, думаете, если мы проиграли, он разве будет нас гладить по голове? Команда играет, но не использует моменты. Из-за этого мы пропускаем и проигрываем. Конечно, все недовольны, все это прекрасно понимают. Надеюсь, исправим ситуацию, все в наших руках, шансы еще есть», – отметил он.
«Газета.Ru» вела онлайн-трансляцию матча «Спартак» - ЦСКА.
Другие материалы, результаты и положение команд можно посмотреть на странице Континентальной хоккейной лиги.

description.hltext_display: Venezuela to make lawmakers vote with their parties
description.content:
CARACAS (Reuters) - Venezuela's National Assembly passed a bill on Tuesday to stop lawmakers voting against their political parties in the latest move of a legislative onslaught before a new parliament is seated next month.
Opponents of socialist President Hugo Chavez say the new bill is an attack on the right of Assembly members to vote with their consciences in South America's biggest oil producer.
The outgoing parliament, which is dominated by members of Chavez's ruling Socialist Party, has passed a raft of laws in recent days including one that lets the former soldier bypass the next Assembly and rule by decree for 18 months.
Tuesday's bill was denounced by a small group of lawmakers who split with Chavez's self-styled revolution. The president of parliament, Cilia Flores, said the new legislation would stop other members from switching sides during the next Assembly.
"With this law we knock down the intentions of others to do what you did," she said in response to criticism from the rebel legislators during the debate.
The next Assembly will have 98 members from Chavez's ruling Socialist Party and 65 from a newly united opposition coalition that won about half the popular vote at a legislative poll in September. It also will have two members from a smaller party.
The most controversial new law was the one giving Chavez decree powers, which the president says he needs to deal with an emergency caused by floods that have killed 40 people and have driven nearly 140,000 from their homes.
That was denounced by opponents who had hoped to hinder his legislative agenda in the new parliament beginning on January 5, and by the U.S. State Department, which said Chavez was subverting the will of the people and finding new and "creative" methods to justify autocratic powers.
(Reporting by Patricia Rondon; Writing by Daniel Wallis; Editing by Bill Trott)
(c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2010. Check for restrictions at: http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

description.hltext_display: Stress verbessert das Gedächtnis
description.content:
dpa Labormaus (Archivbild): Schwimmen als Stresssituation Wer gerade eine stressige Situation hinter sich gebracht hat, erinnert sich besser an zuvor Gelerntes. Dies haben Forscher bei Versuchen mit Mäusen beobachtet. Die Erkenntnis kann womöglich helfen, Therapien gegen Angstzustände zu verbessern.
San Francisco - Geistige Anspannung erhöht das Erinnerungsvermögen. Diesen Schluss legt eine Studie nahe, die tschechische und US-amerikanische Wissenschaftler mit Mäusen durchgeführt haben. Die Forscher wollen nun den Einfluss von Stress auf das Gedächtnis genauer untersuchen, vor allem im Hinblick auf Angststörungen wie die Posttraumatische Belastungsstörung, bei der negative Erlebnisse unbewusst mit eigentlich harmlosen Situationen verknüpft werden. Der Schlüsselfaktor könnte auch hier der Stress sein, vermuten die Wissenschaftler. Ein besseres Verständnis der Verknüpfungsvorgänge trage daher möglicherweise zu effektiveren Therapien bei, hoffen die Forscher um André Fenton von der New York University. Sie berichten von ihren Ergebnissen im Fachmagazin "Plos Biology".
Für ihre Studie ließen die Wissenschaftler die Mäuse zunächst ein Labyrinth erkunden. Anschließend setzten sie die Hälfte der Tiere einer Stresssituation aus, indem sie sie durch einen Wasserbehälter schwimmen ließen. Die andere Hälfte der Mäuse wurde ebenfalls in einen Behälter mit Wasser gesetzt, allerdings mit so niedrigem Wasserstand, dass die Tiere problemlos hindurchwaten konnten.
Stress als entscheidendes Bindeglied? Anschließend wurden die Nager erneut mit dem Labyrinth konfrontiert - mit eindeutigem Ergebnis: Die Mäuse, die zuvor Stress erfahren hatten, erinnerten sich deutlich besser an den Weg durch den Irrgarten als die Kontrolltiere. "Unsere Resultate zeigen, dass Stress das Gedächtnis aktivieren kann, selbst wenn die Erinnerungen nicht mit der Stresssituation in Verbindung stehen", sagt Fenton. Die Ergebnisse könnten auch helfen, Angststörungen wie die Posttraumatische Belastungsstörung besser zu verstehen, glauben die Forscher. Unter dieser Bezeichnung werden körperliche und psychische Symptome zusammengefasst, die infolge eines traumatischen Erlebnisses wie etwa eines schweren Unfalls oder einer Vergewaltigung auftreten.
Neben häufigen Symptomen wie Depressionen, Angstzuständen, Selbstverletzungen und Schlafstörungen verbindet eine weitere Auffälligkeit viele Trauma-Opfer: Sie meiden Orte, Menschen und Aktivitäten, die die Erinnerungen an das schlimme Erlebnis wachrufen könnten. Die gemiedenen Situationen sind dabei oft an und für sich völlig harmlos und eigentlich nicht mit dem Ereignis verknüpft.
Teil vieler Therapien ist es, die trotzdem empfundene Verbindung mit dem traumatischen Ereignis zu lösen. Dies könnte umso effektiver gelingen, je besser verstanden wird, wie diese Verknüpfung bei den Betroffenen entsteht. Die neuen Ergebnisse legten nun nahe, dass das entscheidende Bindeglied auch hier der Stress sein könnte, sagen die Wissenschaftler. Denn auch bei den Mäusen habe sich offensichtlich nicht allein die Stresssituation ins Gedächtnis eingebrannt, sondern auch ein vorhergehendes Ereignis, nämlich der Gang durchs Labyrinth.
hda/dapd

description.hltext_display: Никуда плей-офф от нас не денется
description.content:
Хоккеисты "Спартака" о победе над ЦСКА
ТЕКСТ: Андрей Карташов
ФОТО: Кирилл Лебедев
ПОДРОБНОСТИ
Спартак — ЦСКА 3:0
Спартак (Москва) - ЦСКА (Москва) 3:0 (0:0, 2:0, 1:0)
1-0. Селезнев (Федоров), 28:53
2-0. Сидякин (Будкин), 31:52
3-0. Князев (Пиганович, М.Юньков), 53:01-бол
Спартак: Гашек - Будкин, Селезнев, Баранка, Бодров, Вишневский, Пиганович - Суглобов, Жуков, Губин, Шкотов, Ружичка, Федоров, Сидякин, Микуш, М.Юньков, Князев, Радивоевич, Лапенков
ЦСКА: Валикетт - Пашнин, Марченко, Курбатов, Мишарин, Часлава, Корнеев, Пиларж, Рылов - Пронин, Михайлов, Марек, Андронов, Штястны, Паршин, Зубов, Бадюков, Нетик, Козлов, Кулемин, Гусев
Броски: 30 (5-13-12) - 24 (14-6-4)
Штраф: 17-29
Судьи: Оленин, Раводин (оба - Москва)
Москва. ДС "Сокольники". 2750 зрителей
Вратарь «Спартака» Доминик Гашек рассказал «Газете.Ru», о важности победы над ЦСКА и нескромно добавил, что считает себя главным героем матча. Бранко Радивоевич отметил, что хотел бы видеть на трибунах больше болельщиков, а не милиционеров. А Яков Селезнев вспомнил самую серьезную драку в своей жизни.
Московский «Спартак» в очередной раз в этом сезоне одержал уверенную победу над ЦСКА. Из четырех очных матчей красно-белые выиграли три. После этой победы спартаковцы смогли закрепиться в зоне плей-офф, а армейцев почти наверняка оставили за бортом.
«Мы играли просто отлично, – признался нападающий Бранко Радивоевич. – Если будем играть так дальше, то никуда плей-офф от нас не денется. Еще недавно мы были далеко за чертой, но теперь есть шанс подняться выше. От Минска и Риги нас оделяет всего лишь очко. Да, у соперников есть пара матчей в запасе, но их еще надо выиграть.
А для нас, каждая следующая игра в новом году будет, как матч плей-офф».
Также Радо отметил, что хотел бы увидеть на принципиальном матче с ЦСКА больше болельщиков. «Дерби – это всегда отдельная история. Команды бьются, болельщики не успокаиваются ни на секунду. Жалко, правда, что на этот раз фанатов было не так много, как хотелось бы. Перед игрой видел много милиции. Очень много.
Лучше бы столько болельщиков пришло на матч, сколько милиционеров (смеется)».
Героем встречи бал признан вратарь «Спартака» Доминик Гашек, который не пропустил ни одной шайбы. «Да, один раз я отстоял насухо на выезде, теперь, вот дома, – улыбался Гашек. – Кстати была еще одна игра, которую мы проиграли 0:1 по буллитам. Надо будет поинтересоваться, считается ли это, как сухая игра».
На нескромный вопрос, чувствует ли он себя настоящим героем матча с ЦСКА, Доминатор ответил откровенно: «Я всегда герой!». Затем Гашек искренне рассмеялся и повторил эту фразу еще раз. Чтобы услышала вся спартаковская раздевалка. Хотя, кажется, его никто из партнеров по команде не услышал. На всю раздевалку гремела клубная музыка. Ребята в хорошем настроении закончили неудачно складывающийся год.
«Вот теперь чувствуется, что скоро Новый год, – сказал чешский вратарь «Спартака». – Немного обидно, что мы с ребятами его встретим в Швейцарии. А так бы я с удовольствием покатался на катке на Красной Площади. Там красиво… Или на лыжах – просто обожаю кататься. На коньках тоже неплохо, но я ведь всю жизнь играю в хоккей. Поэтому теперь самое время кататься на лыжах (смеется)».
Последняя календарная игра «Спартака» в уходящем году будет со СКА. Гашек с неохотой ответил на вопрос о питерской команде. Сказал банальные вещи: сильная команда, отличный подбор исполнителей. Правда об отъезде Евгения Набокова чех рассказал подробнее. «Я не знаю, почему так произошло. Женя сильный вратарь. Помню, как он здорово играл в НХЛ.
Может быть, кстати, Набоков не смог перестроиться на большой лед.
Я не могу судить о его карьере в КХЛ, потому что видел всего три-четыре матча Набокова. Но в них он играл не очень хорошо».
Якова Селезнева также можно причислить к героям матча. Он забил первую, самую важную шайбу «Спартака». А затем не испугался кулаков Петра Чаславы: «Драки в хоккее случаются – ерунда и ничего особенного. Все произошло быстро – без драк в хоккее не бывает, – сказал Селезнев. – Самая запоминающаяся драка была года два назад. Я еще в Хабаровске играл. Мы подрались с Друговым – это было сильно. А героем матча с ЦСКА я себя не считаю. Партнеры сделали хороший пас – мне оставалось только не промазать».
«Желание обыграть ЦСКА было огромным. Прям вообще. Конечно, хотелось бы больше болельщиков увидеть на трибунах. Но мы же в Москве живем. У всех свои проблемы. Людям просто не до нас, видимо», – добавил Селезнев.
«Газета.Ru» вела онлайн-трансляцию матча «Спартак» - ЦСКА.
Другие материалы, результаты и положение команд можно посмотреть на странице Континентальной хоккейной лиги.
Тeги: КХЛ, ХК Спартак, Доминик Гашек, Бранко Радивоевич

description.hltext_display: BRIEF-Turkcell-Turkish court suspends its 279 mln lira tax fine pending court case

description.hltext_display: Louisville tops Southern Miss in Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl
description.content:
Chris Philpott kicked the go-ahead 36- yard field goal in the fourth quarter, and Louisville held on for a 31-28 victory over Southern Miss in the Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl.
Jeremy Wright returned a kickoff 95 yards for a touchdown earlier in the fourth to help the Cardinals (7-6) overcome a deficit and secure a winning season in head coach Charlie Strong's first year. Louisville also recorded its first postseason victory since the 2007 Orange Bowl.
Justin Burke threw for 178 yards and two touchdowns for the Cardinals, while Bilal Powell ran for 75 yards and a score.
"It was a total team effort," Louisville head coach Charlie Strong said. "That's what this team is all about."
Austin Davis passed for 205 yards and two scores for Southern Miss (8-5), which was making a ninth consecutive bowl appearance, but lost for the second straight year.
Southern Miss took a 28-21 lead on the opening play of the fourth quarter. The Golden Eagles had driven from midfield to the eight before Austin Davis completed a pass to tight end Zeke Walters on the right edge of the end zone.
But on the ensuing kickoff, Wright made his way through traffic to the left sideline, picked up one final block and sprinted into the end zone to even the game again.
Louisville forced a punt and took over deep in its own territory. Burke led the Cardinals into Southern Miss territory, but the drive stalled and Philpott kicked his field goal with 6:30 to play.
Cardinals linebacker Brandon Heath made a key third-down sack of Davis on the next Southern Miss possession, forcing a three-and-out. The failure to move the ball doomed the Golden Eagles, whose defense stopped Louisville too late. Southern Miss got the ball back with only seconds remaining and couldn't pull off a miracle play.
The Golden Eagles got out to a 14-0 lead on two first-quarter touchdowns. Quentin Pierce had a 32-yard TD reception about three minutes into the game, while Desmond Johnson scored on a 62-yard run with 10:12 left.
Louisville made up the deficit, though, by reaching the end zone three times in the second quarter.
Cameron Graham caught an 11-yard strike from Burke with 11:21 on the clock to get the Cardinals on the board. Southern Miss responded about two minutes later when Davis caught a 17-yard touchdown throw from Pierce, a wide receiver.
But Josh Chichester's 10-yard reception and Powell's six-yard run later in the half allowed Louisville to go into halftime tied, 21-21.
"I think we had chances to make more plays on offense," Davis said. "We missed on a couple plays that keep you up at night."
Game Notes
Johnson ran for 102 yards on 10 carries for Southern Miss...Louisville's Doug Beaumont led all receivers with seven catches for 57 yards...Southern Miss out-gained Louisville, 396-287, but averaged just 18.5 yards on four kickoff returns.
©2010 Sports Network. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.

description.hltext_display: 싸이더스HQ "박진영은 재범 일 속시원히 밝혀라"
description.content:
김동현 기자 hellopik@chosun.com 기자의 다른 기사보기
기사
입력 : 2010.12.22 17:39
그룹 2PM의 전 멤버 재범(23·본명 박재범)의 탈퇴사유에 대한 논란이 또다시 불거지고 있다.
재범의 전 소속사 JYP엔터테인먼트의 대표 박진영(38)은 21일 방송된 KBS 2TV ‘김승우의 승승장구’에서 재범의 탈퇴사유에 대한 질문에 “(당시) 회사에서 입장을 냈는데 거기서 더 무슨 이야기를 더 하겠느냐. 이 친구(재범)가 다칠 수도 있는 일”이라고 말했다.
이에 재범의 현 소속사인 싸이더스HQ가 발끈하고 나섰다. 싸이더스HQ는 다음날인 22일 자사 홈페이지에 ‘박진영씨의 박재범군 발언에 대한 공식 입장’이라는 글을 올려 “박진영씨의 발언에 유감을 표한다”고 밝혔다. 이 글은 “박진영씨는 ‘진실을 밝히면 이 친구가 다친다’는 뉘앙스의 이야기로 오히려 확인되지 않는 온갖 추측을 양산해내고 있다”며 “또 다른 논란을 불러일으킨 박진영씨의 의도가 뭔지 궁금할 따름”이라고 지적했다.
이어 “왜 사실을 말할 수 없는 것이냐”며 “우리는 ‘밝히면 다친다’는 박재범군의 일이 오히려 궁금하다. JYP엔터테인먼트는 당당하고 속 시원히 밝혀주시길 바란다”고 요구했다.
2PM의 리더였던 재범은 연습생 시절 인터넷에 올린 글이 한국 비하 논란을 일으키면서 지난해 9월 팀을 탈퇴하고 미국으로 떠났다. 이후 논란이 잠잠해져 복귀여부가 거론됐으나 당시 소속사였던 JYP는 올해 2월 ‘또다른 사생활 문제’를 이유로 재범의 영구탈퇴를 발표했다.
당시 JYP는 “재범이 지난해 여름 ‘어겐 & 어겐’ 활동 당시 저지른 잘못이 뒤늦게 불거졌다. 팀 탈퇴 당시 문제보다 사회적으로 심각한 문제를 초래할 수 있는 사안”이라고 설명했으나, 구체적인 내용은 ‘사생활 문제’라며 언급하지 않았다.
각종 논란에도 인기를 유지하던 재범은 올해 6월 할리우드 영화 촬영차 한국에 입국했으며, 이후 싸이더스HQ와 전속계약을 맺은 상태다.

description.hltext_display: Ξεπέρασε τα 90 δολ. η τιμή του αργού
description.author: editors@naftemporiki.gr (Η ΝΑΥΤΕΜΠΟΡΙΚΗ ON LIN
description.content:
Πάνω από τα 90 δολάρια το βαρέλι αναρριχήθηκε σήμερα η τιμή του αργού, μετά τη μείωση των αποθεμάτων πετρελαίου λόγω του ψύχους που πλήττει τις Ηνωμένες Πολιτείες και τη Βόρεια Ευρώπη.
Στις 09:44 (ώρα Ελλάδος), η τιμή του αμερικανικού ελαφρού αργού ενισχυόταν 21 σεντς στα 90,03 δολάρια το βαρέλι, ενώ η τιμή του πετρελαίου τύπου Brent σημείωνε άνοδο 25 σεντς στα 93,45 δολάρια το βαρέλι.
Σύμφωνα με τα στοιχεία του Αμερικανού Πετρελαϊκού Ινστιτούτου, τα εβδομαδιαία αποθέματα αργού μειώθηκαν κατά 5,8 εκατ. βαρέλια, ξεπερνώντας τις προβλέψεις των αναλυτών.
«Η μεγάλη μείωση των αποθεμάτων αργού οδήγησε την πετρελαϊκή αγορά σε άνοδο. Αλλά το αγοραστικό ενδιαφέρον σε αυτά τα επίπεδα, κοντά στα 90 δολάρια το βαρέλι, δεν είναι σημαντικό», παρατηρεί αναλυτής της ιαπωνικής Newedge.

description.hltext_display: ?Second Mum? Val makes a differenceacross Eastern Europe
description.author: Rachael Misstear
description.content:
SHE’S been shot at, locked up in prison and has driven an aid bus through the night with only the moonlight to guide her.
Val Newton’s 20 years as an aid worker has seen her brave the rigours of the world to raise funds to educate, house and help thousands of people in deprived and war-ravaged countries in Eastern Europe.
Val, who runs her Romanian Aid Charity from her home in Maes-y-bont, near Cross Hands in Carmarthenshire has built 122 houses and put 63 students through university.
Electricity, running water and heating have also been provided; holidays have been laid on and university education has been made possible.
She has made a real impact with her team of helpers, addressing the needs of youngsters and families in Romania, Moldova, Kosovo, Bosnia and Croatia.
Many children in these countries call her their "second mum” and some have likened her to Mother Teresa.
Val, who is 70, simply puts the success stories of her work down to the support she has had from the South-West Wales communities that support her cause.
She identified her cause after watching a Challenge Anneka TV programme in 1991 in which a Romanian orphanage was rebuilt. The desperate situation faced by the orphans was a catalyst for something that has changed Val’s life.
She and her late husband Bill got talking and thinking — and Wales Romanian Aid was born.
The impact the charity has had in Eastern Europe has been immense, and Val visits, with aid supplies, up to six times each year.
Val said that in the aftermath of the 1989 Romanian Revolution there was a massive aid effort for the country.
"The story of the orphans was horrific and to be honest the whole of Europe responded to that. During our first missions, every time we went across we would meet up with all the other aid workers at the border.
"Bill and I thought it would be a one-off, we took our car and followed two busses to Romania. Nineteen years later and I have done 128 trips.
"What got to me was seeing children running around in the street in the middle of March, when snow was heavy on the ground, with just rags on their feet.
"The orphanages were awful. We were taken to hospitals, mostly mental hospitals that were horrific, with plaster falling off the walls and the people were miserable.
"They told us they had no medicine, they had one needle and near on 100 patients. There were tumble-down houses and it was just a different world.”
Since then the charity she runs has re-homed dozens of the most needy families, built two schools and two churches.
Thousands of children have been given respite from impoverished conditions thanks to holidays arranged and paid for by the charity.
"It started after that first visit. We came back and we got to work. The first thing we needed was a bus. The idea of a bus is you can live in it, sleep in it and eat in it, and if you take all the seats out, bar a few in the front you can carry eight or nine tonnes of aid.”
"In those days you could drive a six-seater ‘minibus’ on an ordinary driving license. So with just six seats in our bus, and with a few lessons from a bus driver in Swansea, that’s what we set off in.”
To drum up support and collect the vast amounts of aid the couple parked up outside superstores like Tesco in Carmarthen and Marks & Spencer in Swansea with pictures of the plight of people in Romania.
"We had so much support and it felt like everyone was behind us.”
The couple collected dried foods, like pasta and rice, tins of fruit as well as clothing.
"Romania, Kosovo and Moldova are my causes at the moment,” said Val, who, thanks to securing sponsors has managed to employ three people based in those countries as hands-on help to implement the aid work.
"Their salaries are supported by sponsors here in Wales and in Ireland,” said Val who is originally from Kilkenny.”
But as well as national recognition and commendation, Val’s belief in the cause has brought her criticism for her willingness to defy any danger posed.
Being threatened with gunfire and a bus being hit by a bullet from by warring Serbs were not enough to deter her.
Having gathered 20 tonnes of aid and enlisted the help of two Swansea bus drivers, the couple went to Bosnia during the war, where they knew there were millions of refugees.
"We knew it was safe to go so far and then we would be directed by the police of local people. We got to Zadar between the Rijeka and Split on Croatian coast.
"We stopped to have something to eat and a cup of tea. It was dark all around us but I assumed there was a power cut in the nearby villages.
"But a police car came roaring up to us shouting and told us we were a sitting target for the Serbs and that we had guns trained on us.
"We were made to turn out our lights and drive at variable slow speeds so that we weren’t travelling at a constant, an easy target, if you like.
"Fortunately there was a bright moon so we could see the road but the people with us were furious that I had taken them into such danger. Especially as I had promised the trip would not be problematic.”
After the journey it became apparent they had been hit by a bullet but hadn’t realised at the time.
But for Val such obstacles are all part of a big and necessary adventure that can help dramatically change lives.
"I do what I have to do. You can’t collect all that aid and then not take it to where it is most needed.
"We had a tremendous job trying to find where our loads were going to go. Refugees were packed into railway carriages surrounded by barbed wire, packed into schools and houses and our help was desperately needed.
"We found a local priest who took us around and told us roughly what to leave people.”
Val’s tenacity is an inherent part of her character. She has enjoyed motorcycle rallying, with Bill, for more than 50 years.
At 70, she is a formidable competitor, still winning competitions to this day.
Together Val and Bill did 35 trips on their bus together, each time making trips of more than 4,000 miles – to Romania, to Moldova, and to Croatia in the winter.
During the war in Croatia the couple rang the embassy in London to ask what was needed and having been told "blankets”, they set about squirrelling the necessary supplies.
An appeal in the local newspaper led to a holiday park in Ferryside, which was changing its stocks to duvets, offered them thousands of pure wool blankets.
"They were such good quality that even on trips there today, 20 years on I still see those blankets being used in people’s houses,” said Val.
In 1995 the couple took their aid to refugees from Bosnia, many of whom were women who had lost sons and husbands in the Srebrenica Massacre, in which thousands of Bosnian men and boys were murdered.
"That was a harrowing time but you have to stay focused on doing what you can to help.”
The devastating news that Bill had cancer would knock Val, but eventually inspired her to do more than she could have dreamed.
"When the war in Kosovo was on, just after Bill had died, my children, two sons, were in London, my daughter was in Australia and I just had to say to myself ‘you can’t just sit here and cry. Do something’.
"I went to Tesco’s and asked them if I could stand outside with some pictures and simply ask people for food. I knew they’d give it to me because by now I was well know for doing this.
"The response was phenomenal. It just poured in. It took just three weeks to collect 16 tonnes of food.
"I simply put a bucket down for diesel money and nearly everyone put their change in it. I raised more than £3,000 and there was nothing that could stop me.”
Over the years Val has learned that you have to take the donated food directly to its recipients, otherwise it is pilfered by other needy or greedy hands.
"It is stolen or sold and someone will have taken the cream of it.
"I have to be able to come back to Carmarthenshire and show everyone who donated that it got to its destination and over the years I have proved myself,” said Val.
Val said that making donations directly to children in orphanages is one of the hardest things to ensure.
"The desperately sad thing is that when you take things to the orphanages, often you can give them nice new clothes, shoes and toys to play with but within 48 hours it will probably have been taken off them because the washerwomen there will have taken them for their own children. In fairness they wouldn’t get salaries and very often had 10 little ones to clothe and feed.”
"We mainly take them things like chocolate or treats to eat and we take them away on holidays where they can have a week in the year when they have fun, are care free time with plenty to eat.”
This year Val has taken 60 children on holiday, given them new clothes, discontinued stock donated by Adams children’s store in Carmarthen.
Val’s work has been officially recognised via many varied accolades. As well as receiving an MBE along side her husband Bill in 1997, in recognition of her efforts she was voted one the greatest Carmarthenshire people of all time in a poll run by the local authority.
She has also won several community awards.
But perhaps one of the strangest commendations came from a surgeon at a private hospital near Carmarthen.
Having heard of Val’s projects and wanting her to continue her work he offered to do an operation for free because a problem with her hip was making her life difficult.
"That was his way of helping me to help others, or that was how he put it at the time,” said Val.
Her enthusiasm is infectious she tells anyone prepared to listen about the plight of the people she wants to help and uses church contacts in Ireland to boost the funds collected in Wales.
She knows that a little support here can go a long way in Eastern Europe. Many of the houses she builds are created for about £6,000 and the work keeps a trusted builder in employment for six months of the year.
It means families living in cramped, water-logged and muddied shacks no bigger than bus shelters, are given dry, warm modest houses to live in.
But above all else Val believes education is a key way of improving lives. She is proud that more than 60 students have been through university as a result of the charity’s funding.
Among Val’s supporters, though the majority are from South-West Wales, are Sir Cliff Richard, who makes a donation every three years.
"A little money goes a long way in Eastern Europe and with more support from other celebrities or wealthier people we can really change lives. I have had a lot of publicity locally but it would be good to reach out further across the country.
"I’m not asking for huge amounts, just what people can spare. It all adds up and can make the world of difference.”
To give to the Wales Romanian Aid appeal, call Val on 01269 843 345 or contact her at Tycroes, Maes-y-bont, Cross Hands, Llanelli, SA14 7HD
