description.hltext_display: 上演时空穿越 法韩6款概念车-现身车展
description.content:
收藏(-人收藏)复制链接 打印来源：TOM 汽车
【共-条评论】【我要评论】时间：2010-12-22 09:10
一、雪铁龙Lacoste概念车
雪铁龙Lacoste概念车基于C1底盘开发，整车外观极具未来科技感，给人以极强的视觉感受。从车型定义来看这款车有点微型SUV和紧凑型汽车跨界设计的感觉，概念车前脸较短，外形非常可爱。前挡风玻璃可以向前倾倒在引擎盖上，是不是有点老式越野车的感觉？轮毂可以说是Lacoste概念车的一大亮点，几乎是前所未见。一整块金属轮毂上镂空了数十个正方形格子，规则的排列在了一起。
二、雪铁龙Metropolis概念车
Metropolis概念车的外观第一眼看上去像是C5的加大版，但细微之处却有太多不同，超大的车身尺寸已超过宝马7系，绝对算的上是豪华旗舰车型了。虽然雪铁龙官方对前进气格栅的形容是风筝造型，但我个人感觉更像是武士的胸甲整体华丽宽敞的外观设计与泛着珍珠般光泽的外表形成了鲜明的对比。突出了这款车与众不同的高雅以及独具匠心的设计，而保险杠最下端的前唇凸显其运动性。车身两侧的前灯造型细长犀利，所有光源均采用了LED灯泡，时尚前卫。
三、标致EX1概念车
EX1是标致为庆祝其成立两百周年，而特意打造的一款电动概念跑车，车身结构非常新颖，并且是基于“水滴”的造型而研发的。“漂浮式”的前栅格和高抛光的铝制金属组件让这款车看起来科技感十足。标致EX1的车身运用了极为“未来化”的设计，反向开启的车门给乘客不一样的感受。另外这款车的车高仅有0.9米，大大降低了EX1的风阻系数。

description.hltext_display: Coal importers Bhatia, Adani get the boot
description.content:
NAGPUR: Mahagenco has finally woken up to the massive irregularities going on in the supply of imported coal and terminated the contract of its two suppliers - M/s Bhatia Ltd and M/s Adani Ltd. It has also issued a show-cause notice to Geo-Chem Laboratories, which was testing the coal imported by Bhatia and Adani.
This is the first time in history of Mahagenco that coal import has been terminated midway. The generation company terminated Adani and Bhatia's contract on December 16 for supplying inferior quality coal. The contract would end on February 16, 2011.
Leader of Opposition Eknath Khadse had levelled serious allegations against Mahagenco and Bhatia in the just concluded winter session of state legislature. Mahagenco sources said that Bhatia was awarded the contract of supplying coal to four power stations - Chandrapur, Khaparkheda, Nasik and Bhusawal while Adani supplies Parli. Koradi and Paras power stations ran only on imported coal, they added. The two companies were asked to import 33.50 lakh ton per year.
Sources further said as per Mahagenco norms the gross calorific value (GCV) of imported coal should be minimum 6,300 KCal per kilogram. However, it was found that the GCV of coal supplied by Bhatia and Adani was 700-800 KCal less than this threshold.
Bhatia had quoted very low rates for imported coal, which raised Mahagenco's hackles. It appointed two agencies Geo-Chem Laboraties and IGI for testing the quality of this coal. Geo-Chem quoted unbelievably low rates for the job. It offered to do the job for 66 paise per ton while IGI's rates were Rs 4.35 per ton. The third bidder quoted Rs 5.45 per ton.
Sources said that as Mahagenco's budget allowed a rate of Rs 5 per ton it gave the job to Geo-Chem as well as IGI. The latter company was to cross-check the samples. This proved to Geo-Chem's undoing. Geo-Chem had reported that the GCV of the imported coal was 6,300 per KCal/kg as required by Mahagenco. However, IGI stated that it was between 5,500 and 5,600 per KCal/kg. The huge discrepancies between the two reports made the Mahagenco top bosses suspicious. They gave the boot to Bhatia and Adani after investigating at company level.
Geo-Chem's rates have always baffled power officials. It had tested imported coal for Gujarat state electricity corporation limited (GSECL) at an unbelievably low rate of 4 paise per KCal/kg. One of the competitors had complained to GSECL but the company had justified its decision. The NTPC had prematurely terminated Geo-Chem's contract for unsatisfactory work at Badarpur power plant.

description.hltext_display: El 75.869 se lleva un quinto premio
description.author: EL PAÍS
description.content:
El 75.869 ha inaugurado los premios del sorteo de Navidad. A las 9.34 las niñas de San Ildefonso han cantado el primer premio del día y que ha correspondido a un quinto premio, con 50.000 euros a la serie. El décimo se ha vendido, entre otros lugares, en Tarragona, Valladolid y Pontevedra.
El sorteo arrancó a las 9.19. con la novedad de un cambio de escenario. Desde hace 47 años los que los niños de San Ildefonso cantaban los números desde el Salón de Sorteos de Guzmán el Bueno, en Madrid, hoy lo hacen en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid, lugar en el que repartirá 2.320.500.000 euros en premios.
A las 8.00 se abrieron las puertas para dejar pasar a un público siempre entregado, que este año es más numeroso: 1.909 personas están viendo en directo el sorteo. Uno de los motivos que provocó al cambio de sede: "Últimamente había ya muchos problemas de espacio, debido a la gran cantidad de público que asiste al sorteo y al gran número de periodistas acreditados", señalaba ayer el director de Gestión y Producción de Loterías del Estado, Eduardo Ovies. La gente ha esperado largas colas para entrar en el salón, donde muchas personas han acudido disfrazadas o con prendas típicas de Navidad.
Ayer se completó en el remozado salón toda la parafernalia propia del sorteo y los empleados de (LAE) procedieron a colgar los números (desde el 00.000 hasta el 84.999) en un total de 170 liras (expositores verticales en los que se ordenan las bolas para facilitar su comprobación). Las liras cuelgan, a su vez, de los "paraguas", dispositivos desde los que se van a volcar hoy las bolas a la tolva, una especie de embudo transparente que se utiliza para introducir las bolas en los bombos. El público presente en la sala han podido comprobar esta mañana que la bolita con el número que juega está entre las 85.000 que se han volcado en el bombo.
Formas de seguir el sorteo
Para el resto de personas que han comprado lotería este año, que no vivan en Madrid o que aún no estén de vacaciones navideñas, lo pueden o comprobar en tiempo real en los números premiados a través de un buscador. Además de la posibilidad de poder consultar si su número ha sido uno de los afortunados a través del móvil, el iPhone o el iPad, o colocando en su blog o página web el widget.
Entre las novedades del sorteo de este año destacan, además del cambio de sede, el décimo electrónico, con el que espera recaudar 40 millones de euros, y la posibilidad de cobrar los premios superiores a 3.000 euros a partir del día siguiente al sorteo (hasta ahora había que esperar al menos nueve días).
Las cifras más significativas del sorteo de Navidad son idénticas a las del pasado año: 195 series, cada una de ella con 85.000 billetes; el precio de cada billete es de 200 euros, dividido en décimos de 20 euros. Los premios también se mantendrán igual que en anteriores ediciones, con El Gordo de tres millones a la serie y un segundo y tercer premio de un millón y 500.000 euros a la serie respectivamente. Además, habrá dos cuartos premios de 200.000 euros a la serie y ocho quintos premios de 50.000 euros a la serie.
Aunque irán cayendo premios a lo largo de las tres horas y media que dura el sorteo, sin duda alguna, y como cada año, la estrella de la jornada será el Gordo de Navidad, el premio más deseado. Si nos remontamos al pasado, quizá se sientan un poco más esperanzados aquellos que tengan en sus manos un décimo que termine en cinco, la terminación que más ha caído en El Gordo a lo largo de toda la historia del Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, ya que ha resultado premiado en 32 ocasiones.
10 euros más en el gasto de la lotería
Hace una semana, el director general de (LAE), Gonzalo Fernández, auspiciaba un tibio repunte en la venta de décimos para el sorteo de Navidad. "Los datos que tenemos, que aún no son concluyentes, muestran un ligero incremento respecto al año anterior", ha afirmado Fernández. Para apuntalar este avance, LAE ha informado de otro repunte considerable en el gasto medio por habitante: de 58,55 euros a 68,68.
A mediodía, se sabrá si el sorteo navideño retoma el vuelo en esta edición tras dos años de caídas: en 2009 la recaudación (2.703 millones de euros) bajó un 3% respecto a 2008 (2.786 millones); ese año, los ingresos de LAE descendieron un 2,88% con relación a 2007 (2.867 millones). Que suba el gasto medio por habitante no significa que la recaudación deba subir también. De hecho, el director comercial de LAE, Juan Gallardo, reconoció esta semana que "quizá" el nivel de ventas se sitúe "entre el 1% y el 3% menos".
Lo de que el español gasta más en décimos no lo comparten todos. "Las ventas se han reducido: el cliente habitual que cogía la serie entera ahora no compra más de seis décimos", opone Lucas Montañés, lotero situado en la madrileña Puerta del Sol.Inaugura el sorteo de Navidad, a las 9.34, y da 50.000 euros a la serie.- Por primera vez en 47 años el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad se celebra en el Palacio de los Congresos de Madrid.- Los españoles han gastado 10 euros más de media para intentar ganar El Gordo

description.hltext_display: 动物也疯狂 雪铁龙携手鳄鱼亮相广州车展
Swedish opens $25M Redmond ER
多曲线视觉力 雪铁龙概念车广州车展实拍
description.content:
法式品牌的车型都极具浪漫的风情，但概念车方面则充斥着时尚与前卫。在2010年广州车展上我们见到了世博会法国馆当中的这款概念车――雪铁龙Metropolis概念车，同时这款车也代表着雪铁龙下一步的品牌设计方向，今天就让我们一同更近距离的欣赏这款新车带来的视觉感吧。
Metropolis概念车的外观第一眼看上去像是C5的加大版，但细微之处却有太多不同，超大的车身尺寸已超过宝马7系，绝对算的上是豪华旗舰车型了。虽然雪铁龙官方对前进气格栅的形容是风筝造型，但我个人感觉更像是武士的胸甲整体华丽宽敞的外观设计与泛着珍珠般光泽的外表形成了鲜明的对比。突出了这款车与众不同的高雅以及独具匠心的设计，而保险杠最下端的前唇凸显其运动性。车身两侧的前灯造型细长犀利，所有光源均采用了LED灯泡，时尚前卫。
雪铁龙Metropolis概念车全车身都应用了大量铬合金作为装饰，因为银色一向是代表着未来。车身侧面线条简洁流畅，顶部的平整伸展保证了后排乘客的空间。另外这款车的侧窗采用了折叠的设计，但是今天我们并没有看到实际的操作演示，看来我们只能幻想一下了。猫耳朵造型的后视镜短小精干，但是对于这样一辆大车来说，今后量产开在路上视野必然不好。
车身翼子板处的出风口并不稀奇，我们在酷派、STI、EVO身上都可以找到，只是形状不一而已，一般来说这个设计的作用是为了降低发动机温度、降低刹车盘温度或是纯粹为了美观。不过车身上值得一提的是门把手的设计，看了大半天，我也不清楚这个是用手去开的，还是用遥控器开启的，总之科技感很高。是车就会有它独有的身份标识，而不同以往的是Metropolis概念车的铭牌在宽大的C柱位置上，通过相连的LED装饰灯相连，为车身侧面增色了不少。
我相信没有一个人会拒绝大尺寸轮毂所带来的诱惑，因为它会为整车带来不一般的视觉冲击力，不管作为概念车还是豪华级车，大号轮毂是非常必要的。而Metropolis概念车装配的21寸旋风式轮毂，加上米其林265\35 R21轮胎一定能给你带来不小的虚荣心。该车还配备了四驱系统，另驾驶更有乐趣的同时安全性也进一步提升。
Metropolis概念车的后车窗采用了C5的凹陷式设计理念，增加了后部的流线感。而可升降的暗藏式尾翼则采用了C6车型的元素，尾翼后方的高位刹车灯同样采用了细长的LED光源，夜间看上去更加炫目。车辆尾灯采用条状飞旋标式设计，并由层状结构组成，增加了车尾的力量感，并与车头完美相呼应。与现款的宝马7尾灯内部构造基本一致。排气的设计则是追求时尚与运动的元素，增加了尾部整体视觉感。

description.hltext_display: 剑指smart 起亚POP-概念车亮相广州车展
description.content:
【共-条评论】【我要评论】时间：2010-12-22 09:13
起亚POP电动概念车外形设计十分可爱，车长仅3米出头，两扇车门几乎占据整个3分之2的车身。车门上的车窗采用了椭圆形设计十分像胶囊的造型，四支车轮被设计在了车身的四个角，为车内营造更为宽敞的空间。
这款概念车采用了全景式玻璃车顶，风挡玻璃与车顶合并为一块“鹅蛋型”的大玻璃，视线十分开阔。通过这块大玻璃我们可以清楚的看到驾驶仓内的景象，这款起亚POP概念车采用了类似沙发一样的座椅，可以乘坐三个人。
起亚POP电动概念车采用了中置后驱的布局，电动机和电池等部件设计在了座椅的后方，车头十分短小，座在车内是看不见车头的。车头设计突破了传统，造型可爱，车灯位置是多个反光点，没有我们常见的雾灯。
起亚推出的这款POP电动概念车宣扬的是方便出行环保高效的理念，短小的车身可以方便在拥挤的城市中穿行，高效的电力驱动在节约了汽油的情况下更加环保。这款车型的问世也揭示了未来微型车发展的方向。

description.hltext_display: Young Israel Movement Applauds PM Netanyahus Decision To Publicly Call For Pollard's Release
description.content:
Young Israel Movement Applauds Prime Minister Netanyahu's Decision To
Publicly Call For Pollard's Release
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Contact:
Aaron Troodler
(888) 897-7450
YOUNG ISRAEL MOVEMENT APPLAUDS PRIME MINISTER NETANYAHU'S DECISION TO
PUBLICLY CALL FOR POLLARD'S RELEASE
The following is a statement by National Council of Young Israel President
Shlomo Z. Mostofsky and Executive Vice President Rabbi Pesach Lerner
concerning the announcement by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu
that he will publically and officially call for the release of Jonathan
Pollard:
"The National Council of Young Israel commends Prime Minister Netanyahu for
his decision to officially call upon the United States to release Jonathan
Pollard. The Young Israel Movement has been intimately and actively
involved with Jonathan Pollard's plight for almost 20 years, and we
wholeheartedly agree with the Prime Minister that it is time for the U.S. to
set Jonathan Pollard free and send him home to Israel.
We urge President Obama to heed the calls of prominent law enforcement
personnel and renowned legal professionals such as former U.S. Assistant
Secretary of Defense Lawrence Korb, former U.S. Attorney General Michael
Mukasey, former CIA Director James Woolsey, former Senator Dennis DeConcini
of Arizona, who was Chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee when
Pollard was arrested, and many other elected officials, professors of law,
and community leaders, all of whom concur that Jonathan Pollard's life
sentence is grossly disproportionate when compared to the sentences of
others who have spied for allied nations.
We hope that the White House will note the fact that Jonathan Pollard has
repeatedly expressed remorse for his actions, and acknowledge the fact that
Jonathan's health has been rapidly deteriorating, when considering the Prime
Minister's call to commute his prison sentence.
The National Council of Young Israel strongly encourages people to contact
the White House and their federal representatives and urge them to work
towards immediately securing Jonathan Pollard's freedom.
After spending the past quarter-century in a jail cell, it is time for the
United States to open the prison gates and allow Jonathan Pollard to return
home to his wife, his family, and the Jewish people."
* * * * *
N. Aaron Troodler
Communications Director and Public Relations Coordinator
National Council of Young Israel
(888) 897-7450 (phone & fax)

description.hltext_display: Game developer NCsoft expresses interest in professional baseball
description.content:
SEOUL, Dec. 22 (Yonhap) -- NCsoft Corp., a South Korean online game developer, on Wednesday expressed interest in founding a ninth professional baseball team in the country's top league.
The company said it has submitted a letter of intent to the Korea Baseball Organization (KBO), which operates the eight-team baseball league, to launch the team.

description.hltext_display: The Year in Reading
description.content:
For this week’s column (the last one until the new year) I asked a number of interesting people what book they’d read in 2010 that left a big impression on them, or filled them with intellectual energy, or made them wish it were better known. If all three, then so much the better. I didn’t specify that it had to be a new book, nor was availability in English a requirement.
My correspondents were enthusiastic about expressing their enthusiasm. One of them was prepared to name 10 books – but that’s making a list, rather than a selection. I drew the line at two titles per person. Here are the results.
Lila Guterman is a senior editor at Chemical and Engineering News, the weekly magazine published by the American Chemical Society. She said it was easier to pick an outstanding title from 2010 than it might have been in previous years: “Not sleeping, thanks to a difficult pregnancy followed by a crazy newborn, makes it almost impossible for me to read!”
She named Rebecca Skloot’s The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks, published by Crown in February. She called it an “elegantly balanced account of a heartbreaking situation for one family that simultaneously became one of the most important tools of biology and medicine. It was a fast-paced read driven by an incredible amount of reporting: A really exemplary book about bioethics.”
Neil Jumonville, a professor of history at Florida State University, is editor of The New York Intellectual Reader (Routledge, 2007). A couple of collections of essays he recently read while conducting a graduate seminar on the history of liberal and conservative thought in the United States struck him as timely.
“The first is Gregory Schneider, ed., Conservatives in America Since 1930 (NYU Press, 2003). Here we find a very useful progression of essays from the Old Right, Classical Liberals, Traditional Conservatives, anticommunists, and the various guises of the New Right. The second book is Michael Sandel, Liberalism and Its Critics (NYU Press, 1984). Here, among others, are essays from Isaiah Berlin, John Rawls, Robert Nozick, Alisdair MacIntyre, Michael Walzer, a few communitarians represented by Sandel and others, and important pieces by Peter Berger and Hannah Arendt.”
Reading the books alongside one another, he said, tends to sharpen up one's sense of both the variety of political positions covered by broad labels like “liberal” and “conservative” and to point out how the traditions may converge or blend. “Some people understand this beneficial complexity of political positions,” he told me, “but many do not.”
Michael Yates retired as a professor of economics and labor relations at the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown in 2001. His most recent book is In and Out of the Working Class, published by Arbeiter Ring in 2009.
He named Wallace Stegner’s The Gathering of Zion: The Story of the Mormon Trail, originally published in 1964. “I am not a Mormon or religious in the slightest degree,” he said, “and I am well aware of the many dastardly deeds done in the name of the angel Moroni, but I cannot read the history of the Mormons without a feeling of wonder, and I cannot look at the sculpture of the hand cart pioneers in Temple Square [in Salt Lake City] without crying. If only I could live my life with the same sense of purpose and devotion…. It is not possible to understand the West without a thorough knowledge of the Mormons. Their footprints are everywhere."
Adam Kotsko is a visiting assistant professor of religion at Kalamazoo College. This year he published Politics of Redemption: The Social Logic of Salvation (Continuum) and Awkwardness (Zero Books).
“My vote," he said, "would be for Sergey Dogopolski's What is Talmud? The Art of Disagreement, on all three counts. It puts forth the practices of Talmudic debate as a fundamental challenge to one of the deepest preconceptions of Western thought: that agreement is fundamental and disagreement is only the result of a mistake or other contingent obstacle. The notion that disagreements are to be maintained and sharpened rather than dissolved is a major reversal that I'll be processing for a long time to come. Unfortunately, the book is currently only available as an expensive hardcover.”
Helena Fitzgerald is a contributing editor for The New Inquiry, a website occupying some ambiguous position between a New York salon and an online magazine.
She named Patti Smith’s memoir of her relationship with Robert Mapplethorpe, Just Kids, published by Ecco earlier this year and recently issued in paperback. “I've found Smith to be one of the most invigorating artists in existence ever since I heard ‘Land’ for the first time and subsequently spent about 24 straight with it on repeat. She's one of those artists who I've long suspected has all big secrets hoarded somewhere in her private New York City. This book shares a satisfying number of those secrets and that privately legendary city. Just Kids is like the conversation that Patti Smith albums always made you want to have with Patti Smith.”
Cathy Davidson, a professor of English and interdisciplinary studies at Duke University, was recently nominated by President Obama to serve on the National Council on the Humanities. She, too, named Patti Smith’s memoir as one of the books “that rocked my world this year.” (And here the columnist will interrupt to give a third upturned thumb. Just Kids is a moving and very memorable book.)
Davidson also mentioned rereading Tim Berners-Lee's memoir Weaving the Web, first published by HarperSanFrancisco in 1999. She was “inspired by his honesty in letting us know how, at every turn, the World Wide Web's creation was a surprise, including the astonishing willingness of an international community of coders to contribute their unpaid labor for free in order to create the free and open World Wide Web. Many traditional, conventional scientists had no idea what Berners-Lee was up to or what it could possibly mean and, at times, neither did he. His genius is in admitting that he forged ahead, not fully knowing where he was going….”
Bill Fletcher Jr., a senior scholar at the Institute for Policy Studies, is co-author, with Fernando Gapasin, of Solidarity Divided, The Crisis in Organized Labor and A New Path Toward Social Justice, published by the University of California Press in 2009.
He named Marcus Rediker and Peter Linebaugh’s The Many-Headed Hydra: The Hidden History of the Revolutionary Atlantic (Beacon, 2001), calling it “a fascinating look at the development of capitalism in the North Atlantic. It is about class struggle, the anti-racist struggle, gender, forms of organization, and the methods used by the ruling elites to divide the oppressed. It was a GREAT book.”
Astra Taylor has directed two documentaries, Zizek! and Examined Life. She got hold of the bound galleys for James Miller’s Examined Lives: From Socrates to Nietzsche, out next month from Farrar Straus and Giroux. She called it “a book by the last guy I took a university course with and one I've been eagerly awaiting for years. Like a modern day Diogenes Laertius, Miller presents 12 biographical sketches of philosophers, an exploration of self-knowledge and its limits. As anyone who read his biography of Foucault knows, Miller's a master of this sort of thing. The profiles are full of insight and sometimes hilarious.”
Arthur Goldhammer is a senior affiliate of the Center for European Studies at Harvard University and a prolific translator, and he runs an engaging blog called French Politics.
“I would say that Florence Aubenas' Le Quai de Ouistreham (2010) deserves to be better known,” he told me. “Aubenas is a journalist who was held prisoner in Iraq for many months, but upon returning to France she did not choose to sit behind a desk. Rather, she elected to explore the plight of France's ‘precarious’ workers -- those who accept temporary work contracts to perform unskilled labor for low pay and no job security. The indignities she endures in her months of janitorial work make vivid the abstract concept of a ‘dual labor market.’ Astonishingly, despite her fame, only one person recognized her, in itself evidence of the invisibility of social misery in our ‘advanced’ societies.”
Anne Sarah Rubin is an associate professor of history at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County and project director for Sherman’s March and America: Mapping Memory, an interactive historical website.
The book that made the biggest impression on her this year was Judith Giesberg's Army at Home: Women and the Civil War on the Northern Home Front, published by the University of North Carolina Press in 2009. “Too often,” Rubin told me, “historians ignore the lives of working-class women, arguing that we don't have the sources to get inside their lives, but Giesberg proves us wrong. She tells us about women working in Union armories, about soldiers' wives forced to move into almshouses, and African Americans protesting segregated streetcars. This book expands our understanding of the Civil War North, and I am telling everyone about it.”
Siva Vaidhyanathan is a professor of media studies and law at the University of Virginia. His next book, The Googlization of Everything: (And Why We Should Worry), will be published by the University of California Press in March.
He thinks there should have been more attention for Carolyn de la Pena's Empty Pleasures: The Story of Artificial Sweeteners from Saccharin to Splenda, published this year by the University of North Carolina Press: “De la Pena (who is a friend and graduate-school colleague) shows artificial sweeteners have had a powerful cultural influence -- one that far exceeds their power to help people lose weight. In fact, as she demonstrates, there is no empirical reason to believe that using artificial sweeteners helps one lose weight. One clear effect, de la Pena shows, is that artificial sweeteners extend the pernicious notion that we Americans can have something for nothing. And we know how that turns out.”
Vaidhyanathan noted a parallel with his own recent research: “de la Pena's critique of our indulgent dependence on Splenda echoes the argument I make about how the speed and simplicity of Google degrades our own abilities to judge and deliberate about knowledge. Google does not help people lose weight either, it turns out.”
Michael Tomasky covers U.S. politics for The Guardian and is editor-in-chief of Democracy: A Journal of Ideas.
“On my beat,” he said, “the best book I read in 2010 was The Spirit Level (Bloomsbury, 2009), by the British social scientists Richard Wilkinson and Kate Pickett, whose message is summed up in the book's subtitle, which is far better than its execrable title: ‘Why Greater Equality Makes Societies Stronger.’ In non-work life, I'm working my way through Vasily Grossman's Life and Fate from 1959; it's centered around the battle of Stalingrad and is often called the War and Peace of the 20th century. I'm just realizing as I type this how sad it is that Stalingrad is my escape from American politics.”

description.hltext_display: La lotería de Navidad, en directo en El País
description.author: EL PAIS
description.content: El sorteo de navidad arranca a las 9.00 y lo podrás seguir minuto a minuto en Eskup o comprobar en tiempo real en la web EL PAÍS los números premiados a través de un buscador. Además de la posibilidad de poder consultar si tu número ha sido uno de los afortunados a través del móvil, el iPhone o el iPad , o colocando en su blog o página web el widget .

description.hltext_display: FIS红牛高山滑雪世界杯 演绎冰雪世界速度盛宴
description.content:
新浪体育讯 12月19日，在法国瓦尔德伊泽尔举办的Fis红牛高山滑雪速降比赛中，来自美国的世界名将、冬奥会女子速降冠军Lindsey Vonn以51.42秒的速度夺得了冠军。瑞士选手Nadja Kamer以0.68秒之差屈居亚军，而因伤病封闭一年的Lara Gut获得第三名。
Vonn在赛后说“比赛开始我犯了一个很严重的错误，但幸运的是我有足够的时间去弥补，我在这里的状态很稳定，我爱瓦尔德伊泽尔。”Kamer在上个赛季的速降项目中两次站上了领奖台(分别获得第三名和第二名)都与冠军失之交臂，她表示：“在滑雪比赛中，我的速度太慢了，我为我自己的时间感到惊讶。”而Gut则认为她自己就像是在向相反的方向滑行。做为举办地的法国队在此站的比赛中全军覆没，参赛选手的最好成绩为25名。
高山滑雪起源于阿尔卑斯山地域，又称“阿尔卑斯滑雪”或“山地滑雪”，分为速降和回转两项综合赛，是竞速滑雪比赛项目。比赛要求起点和终点的垂直高度为800－1000米。速降(又称滑降)要求运动员从山顶按规定线路穿过用旗插成的门形向下滑行，以滑降两次的时间计算成绩，决定名次。
红牛品牌长期以来鼎力支持世界范围内的多项运动的发展，是极限和速度的拥趸者，是挑战自我、充满生命力的代名词。在高山滑雪的世界里，能感受到速度带来的刺激，可以完成各种不可思议的动作，速度和技巧完美的结合在一起，这和红牛倡导的追求刺激的挑战精神不谋而合，而身披红牛战袍的选手们也用他们完美的表现诠释了这一意义，让红牛的品牌力量在赛场上再次得以体现。正是有了红牛“能量”的补充，越来越多的人都敢于拼搏、突破自我，积极的参与到这一充满激情和快乐的运动中，让高山滑雪成为世界性的赛事。我们也希望，在今年的收官之战中，他们用更好的成绩为本年度的比赛画上一个完美的句点。

description.hltext_display: FIFA meeting cheers RB
description.author: KASUBA MULENGA
description.content:
PRESIDENT Banda says he is happy that FIFA has helped to resolve squabbles in the Football Association of Zambia (FAZ) following a meeting at its headquarters in Zurich on December 21.
The meeting, co-chaired by FIFA president Sepp Blatter, FIFA secretary general Jerome Valckie and Confederation of African Football (CAF) representative Magdi Shams el Din, was attended by leaders of both FAZ factions.
Sports minister Kenneth Chipungu and National Sports Council of Zambia chairman Chifumu Banda were also in attendance.
The President, who is also FAZ patron, said the Kalusha Bwalya-led FAZ executive will in the meantime continue administering Zambian football until 2012 when elections are expected to be held.
Banda was speaking to journalists at City Airport in Lusaka on December 21 shortly after arriving from Mongu where he had gone to officially open the MMD Western Province conference.
“So, it has been a positive thing in that a new element has been added to it. So, the Kalusha FAZ executive will continue until that time and that is when people who want to pass a vote-of-no-confidence can do that,” he said.
Banda said although he has not yet been briefed about the Zurich meeting, he is aware that an agreement has been made between FIFA and the two FAZ executives.
“Zambians who are so much interested in football would like to see this matter resolved in one way or the other. We have to know where we are going,” he said.
During the meeting, FIFA re-stated its endorsement of Kalusha being the legitimate FAZ president.
However, FIFA stated that in the event that some FAZ members want to table a motion of non-confidence against Kalusha and his executive, such a motion would have to be presented at the next general council scheduled in March 2011, following the proper procedures established in the FAZ statutes.
“As such, if FAZ members would like to lodge such a request for inclusion on the agenda of a council meeting, it shall notify the FAZ general secretary at least 21 days before the date of the meeting. This notification can be copied to FIFA and CAF, which in turn will make sure that it is properly addressed by the FAZ general secretariat,” said a statement on the FIFA website.
The statement said FIFA and CAF will continue to monitor closely the Zambian situation and they will send representatives to the March 2011 general council meeting.
Meanwhile, ROBINSON KUNDA and CHISHALA MUSONDA report that FAZ life members and fans have welcomed FIFA’s decision to refer matters of aggrieved parties to the annual general meeting next year.
FAZ life member Luxon Kazabu said in Kitwe on December 21 that the ruling FIFA made in Zurich on Monday is fair and progressive.
Kazabu said there is no winner between FAZ president Kalusha Bwalya and Andrew Kamanga, who was leader of the interim executive, and that only football has won.
“What has happened is that football has won. There is no winner or loser between the Kalusha and Kamanga groups and we have to move forward,” he said.
Kazabu commended the entourage that travelled to Switzerland for the meeting with FIFA and Confederation of African Football (CAF) officials.
Another life member, Michael Chiti, said the decision made by FIFA is the best and has requested stakeholders to adhere to the laid down procedure.
“What FIFA has instructed us to do is the best and for the good of our football in this country and we have to follow the procedure as stated,” said Chiti, a former FAZ president.
Chiti said in future, any occurrences from the March 2011 congress will be referred to because if someone feels injured by the regime running the affairs of the game at any time he can organise a grouping to oust the incumbent.
“A mole eats a mole,” he said.
“If there is a proposal of no confidence, it should be presented to the general secretary of FAZ and this should be included as an item of discussion on the agenda.
“If the idea is accepted or not, that will have to be respected. The right channel of expressing grievances is at the council meeting. It is just sad this matter had to be taken to FIFA when it would have been resolved internally,” he said.
Chiti urged stakeholders to observe the 21 days notice constitutional requirement to submit an item of discussion at the general congress.
Zambia Voluntary Soccer Fans Association patron Peter Makembo said it is good that the world soccer supreme body has finally made the decision.
Makembo attributed the success of the meeting in Zurich to his relentless prayers.
Chipolopolo Soccer Fans Association (CSFA) chairman Yotam Mwanza said the ruling that FIFA made on the legitimacy of the Kalusha-led FAZ executive should settle the differences among soccer administrators.
Mwanza said it is important both parties respect the FIFA ruling if peace is to be restored in the game.
He said there is need for the FAZ executive to embrace the Kamanga-led group in developing the game that has suffered damages in the last few months due to bickering among soccer administrators.
“As fans we are happy that these wrangles have finally come to an end. We agree with the ruling that FIFA made that aggrieved parties should take their grievances to the annual general meeting because it is the only logical thing to do,” he said.
Nchanga Rangers chairman Richard Kazala-Laski said: “I challenge Andrew Kamanga and Simataa Simataa to show leadership quality so that if they want a vote, we can vote for them and they should prove that they did not want to get into the FAZ executive committee through the backdoor. For Kalusha, he should also show that he is a leader by not fighting those who were against him,” he said.
Roan United secretary Sydney Chileya said the club is satisfied of the verdict by FIFA.

in future, any occurrences from the March 2011 congress will be referred to because if someone feels injured by the regime running the affairs of the game at any time he can organise a grouping to oust the incumbent
it is important both parties respect the FIFA ruling if peace is to be restored in the game
the decision made by FIFA is the best and has requested stakeholders to adhere to the laid down procedure
he is happy that FIFA has helped to resolve squabbles in the Football Association of Zambia (FAZ) following a meeting at its headquarters in Zurich on December 21
?What FIFA has instructed us to do is the best and for the good of our football in this country and we have to follow the procedure as stated,?
former president, Football Association of Zambia
although he has not yet been briefed about the Zurich meeting, he is aware that an agreement has been made between FIFA and the two FAZ executives
the club is satisfied of the verdict by FIFA

?I challenge Andrew Kamanga and Simataa Simataa to show leadership quality so that if they want a vote, we can vote for them and they should prove that they did not want to get into the FAZ executive committee through the backdoor

description.hltext_display: Tågproblem i Västsverige
description.content:
Göteborg/TT Efter en mycket kall natt i hela landet, med -36 grader i Idre, är ett nytt område med snö på väg in över norra Götaland och Hälsingland. Kraftiga förseningar väntas i tågtrafiken i dag också. Flygtrafiken till och från London ska fungera som normalt i dag. SMHI har utfärdat en klass 1-varning för att omkring en decimeter snö kan komma fram i Hälsingland under morgonen och förmiddagen.
Trafikverket har satt in extra resurser för att gårdagens snöproblem ska undvikas i dag. Trots det väntas kraftiga förseningar i Västsverige. På grund av växelfel kommer tågen på sträckorna Halmstad-Göteborg och Halmstad-Malmö, det vill säga Västkustbanan, att drabbas av kraftiga förseningar.
Även på sträckan Charlottenberg-Laxå är det problem med tågväxlar vilket orsakar störningar.
- Det vi har är efterdyningar av gårdagens stora problem med växelfel, säger Tommy Andersson på SJ:s pressjour. - En del tåg har hamnat på fel plats i omloppet, kan man säga.
Ett 20-tal tåg i Mälardalen kommer att ersättas av buss och en del passagerare har blivit ombokade till andra avgångar.
Flygtrafiken till och från London ska återupptas i nära nog normal omfattning i dag.
- Som det ser ut just nu så har vi ställt in en Londontur från Stockholm i eftermiddag och från Göteborg ställer vi in en tur och retur till London. Resten hoppas vi verkligen att vi ska kunna få i väg, säger SAS informationschef Elisabeth Manzi.
Situationen i London är fortfarande kaosartad, SAS har närmare 6 000 svenskar strandade där.
För att få hem så många som möjligt planerar SAS att byta till större flygplan.
- Men det är svårt att sitta och lova något, det blir en så skör situation när så många är drabbade. Men nu håller vi tummarna, för vi behöver verkligen lätta på trycket. - Självklart är vårt mål att alla ska få fira jul hemma. Vi gör allt för att få hem alla, säger Elisabeth Manzi.
SAS har kallat in extra personal för att svara på frågor och sköta ombokningar för alla de som drabbats, men väntetiderna har varit mycket långa.
- Vi hoppas på förståelse, men de har förstås behövt utrusta sig med en stor portion tålamod.
Snöröjningen på Londonflygplatsen Heathrow har fått mycket hård kritik.
- Jag är inte någon expert på snöröjning men vi kan ju konstatera att de inte har klarat av att leverera det vi köper, nämligen möjligheten att kunna flyga till den flygplatsen. De har uppenbarligen inte klarat att leva upp till de önskvärda nivåerna, säger Elisabeth Manzi.
När det gäller Paris, Amsterdam och Frankfurt är man i stort sett i kapp med strandade passagerare eftersom trafiken har kunnat upprätthållas, om än med förseningar och inställda flyg.

description.hltext_display: East Wenatchee apartment is sold
百公里油耗仅3升 起亚RAY登陆广州车展
description.content:
收藏(-人收藏)复制链接 打印来源：TOM 汽车
【共-条评论】【我要评论】时间：2010-12-22 09:14
起亚ray概念车外形大量运用气动科技，长长的尾巴和U型行李箱盖延伸改善了空气在车尾的快速流动，从而有效降低了空气阻力。由起亚美国设计中心研发设计的品牌首款Hybrid概念车Ray，创造性地展示了起亚未来的插电式混合动力构造的四人座小型轿车。
这款Ray概念车流畅的车身是由轻量级且可循环再利用的材料制造，并充分体现了最新“Cool Car”技术的节能优越性，顶部设计上运用了纳米分子涂料与特殊玻璃材质吸收太阳能，为玻璃上的六角型电池供电，并通过其与玻璃的结合将电能传输至于额外的照明设备和空调系统，同时这一技术也将户外光线对车内空间的幅射降至最低，有效实现自然资源最优化配置。
ray的动力部分是一款1.4升发动机它能提供153马力（114千瓦）的效能。配合CVT变速箱能够很平顺的行驶。它的混合动力也很特别。引擎负责驱动两个前轮，后轮则由电动机负责。两者之间密切配合，可以单独驱动，也可以协同驱动。根据起亚官方公布的数据，在单独使用电力驱动的情况下，Ray可以行驶80km；整车的续航里程更是可以超过1200km。油电混合模式下的综合油耗可以达到3.0L/100km。未来，Ray概念车诠释的EcoDynamics理念和技术将出现在多款起亚新车上。

description.hltext_display: Musical director named honorary ambassador for PyeongChang's Winter Games bid
description.content:
SEOUL, Dec. 22 (Yonhap) -- The Winter Olympics bidding committee for South Korea's PyeongChang named a popular musical director as its new honorary ambassador on Wednesday, as the east coast alpine town attempts to bring the country its first-ever Winter Games.
At the committee's general meeting held here Wednesday, Kolleen Park, a Korean-German musical director, became an honorary ambassador for PyeongChang's bidding efforts.

description.hltext_display: “流体雕塑” 现代新概念跑车详细解析
description.content:
收藏(-人收藏)复制链接 打印来源：TOM 汽车
【共-条评论】【我要评论】时间：2010-12-22 09:14
概念车凭借这时尚的外形和高科技含量赢得了众多消费者的关注，而它也是汽车厂商展示自己科技力量的舞台。在本届广州车展上，现代汽车带来了概念跑车――i-flow车型，下面就让我们一起来了解一下这款科技感十足的车型。
如同Apple的“i系列”IT产品一样，现代汽车的“i系列”产品从诞生以来就是现代汽车产品中最容易吸引关注的产品。在现代汽车极具未来气息的展区内，亮丽时尚的外观设计、优异的操控和动力表现，以及节能环保等特点使得i-flow一亮相便成为全场关注的焦点。
源自自然的“流体雕塑”（Fluidic Sculpture）设计理念带来了动感时尚的造型，配合巴斯夫公司的“流动金属”特殊油漆，液体的流动性和固体的雕刻感在i-flow上被完美地融合在一起，形成了充满自信和活力的视觉组合，感觉浑然天成。i-flow不仅外形“养眼”，而且融入了出色的空气动力学特性，其风阻系数只有0.25，达到了高级跑车的标准。
随着“i系列”产品的陆续推出，结束人们对现代汽车外观保守及创新不足的旧有印象，这款汽车在节能性和操控方面即采用了多项革命性的领先设计，比如，i-flow是现代汽车首款柴油电力混合汽车，在车顶上安装太阳能板；先进的人车互动技术，不仅可以让驾驭者通过触摸屏来操作，还可直接用语音控制。
i-flow在广州车展的惊艳亮相，表明“i系列”产品已日益成熟，现代汽车在产品造型设计、前沿技术、设计理念等方面迈出了战略性的一步。在产品市场策略方面，随着全新i- flow概念车的量产和上市，将为现代劳恩斯和雅科仕提供更高的定价空间，在提升品牌形象的同时又赚足了利润。
